Reviews.Title: “Convenient but..................”
Reviews.Author: Rick L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Papadopoli for three nights in Feb to see the Venice carnival, which if you've never been, is well worth a visit if only for the costumes parading around San Marco. We booked two rooms, one for my wife and i, and one for our son and his girlfriend. We chose the Papadopoli due to its location , right next to Piazzale Roma which is both the bus and Vaporetti terminus. As we had an early flight home, the hotel proved great in that respect in that you are literally two minutes away from the airport bus stop. The hotel foyer has a classy feel to it and the dining room ( we stayed B &B) was superb, all marble, chandeliers etc. The choice of food for the buffet style breakfast was fine. Our room was situated on the top floor with a narrow balcony that commanded superb views over the roof tops and the church opposite. Surprisingly, the shower was an over the bath type which was slightly disappointing, but on reflection this is the best they could do given the size of the rooms. The corridors and overall decor away from the lobby / dining room were in need of a bit of TLC but overall not too bad. Now for the bad experience. Around midnight, after an alarm had intermittently been going off in our sons room, with no-one answering the phone and unable to get to sleep, they went downstairs to see what could be done. Apparently, the night concierge was quite surly but eventually they got a different room for the night. Despite assurances that the problem would be fixed, it wasn't straight away and further complaints had to be made. Not good enough ! Couple this to the extortionate bar prices (this might be the same in all hotels in Venice ?), and we left feeling slightly disappointed. I had stayed in Venice 3 years earlier, again for the carnival in a hotel just behind San Marco, and as such i have to compare like for like. For convenience its hard to beat, for the rest i'm not too sure.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be faulted”
Reviews.Author: Magyarmike
Reviews.Content: This hotel and their wonderful, helpful staff made our 3 night stay perfect for my first visit to Venice. Others have already mentioned the very convenient location by the central bus station and the main vaporetto dock, but what stands out most was the outstanding, friendly team of staff who go out of their way to be helpful at every opportunity. We had a very nicely decorated room on the 4th floor with a view of the bridge over the canal. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom included an decent sized bath (with overhead shower as well). This was a real luxury for a soak after a long day sightseeing. Bathrobes and slippers were supplied and a complementary bottle of water and nicely wrapped box of local biscuits were waiting for us on the first day. We did not experience any problems with any street noise at any time. Breakfast was a good selection of hot and cold dishes from the buffet and a chef was on hand to prepare egg dishes to order. As our friends were not feeling very well we decided to have dinner in the lovely hotel restaurant. There was a set 3 course menu @ 35 Euros as well a small a la carte list which was pretty good value for a 4 star hotel in Venice. Our bottle of wine was particularly reasonable @ 20 euros. There is a very comfortable bar to the left of the main entrance with the feel of a private room in a country house. Drinks are served with a variety of snacks. I'd like to give a special mention to David, who I believe is the maitre'd. He was very helpful when we asked to move tables on the night we ate at the hotel. It was handled quickly and tactfully. I would not hesitate to reccomend this hotel and if we ever return to Venice this will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Quality”
Reviews.Author: Ningram
Reviews.Content: After reviewing this hotel on Trip Adviser, I booked a 5 night stay as a surprise for my partner's 60th birthday. We were very pleased with what we found. As previous reviews state the location is great if you travel into Venice by bus and it is certainly close enough to 'the main attractions'. The staff were always available to help, the maids kept the room in good order, but the 'jewel in the crown' was the amazing buffet breakfast. If you are visiting and staying in Venice, book this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel - not central but handily located”
Reviews.Author: RPlummerBerkshireUK
Reviews.Content: The Papadopoli is conveniently located just 100 metres from the Piazzale Roma bus station with frequent number 5 bus service to and from the airport. In twenty five minutes for just 3.50 Euros you can be leaving Arrivals and be at Hotel reception. Your first impressions are of a very typical venetian hotel facing straight onto a small canal. At Reception you will receive a friendly greeting before taking either of two rather small but reliable lifts to your floor. The rooms are comfortable and well equiped with flat screen TVs with a wide selection of chanels (several in English) and coffee and tea making facilities. Beds are extremely comfortable and bathrooms provide all the usual facilities, all in good working order. While the rooms are very clean, most rooms have two small balconies which could do with some regular attention including rennovation and regular cleaning. The location of the hotel is in the north of the Island of Venice just accross the Grand Canale from both the railway station (Ferrovia) and the Ferrovia vaporetto berths with waterbusses around the main island, down the Grand Canale to the Rialto Bridge and beyond down to Academia and Saint Mark's Square (take numbers 1 and 2). A Number 3 waterbus from Ferrovia will take you directly to the Island of Murano. For those who want to explore Venice by foot, make sure you have an excellent map but you can reach the Rialto and Saint Mark's Square within 30 minutes. It is 10 minutes by boat. The hotel restaurant gives the impression of being within a garden with vines growing up the walls and overhead. An excellent breakfast buffet is served each morning offering the usual selection of eggs, cheeses, salamis, fruit, pastries complemented by a chef providing omelettes,etc to order. The only danger with the buffet is that your diet will be completely ruined before you go out the door. While the Restaurant provides an excellent breakfast, evening meals are hit and miss. My wife and I have stayed twice in the Papadopoli and dined in the restaurant both times and both times we have have good and not so good experiences. I would advise walking some 300 metres to the Ristorante Ribot where you will be greeted as if members of the family and you will enjoy an excellent relaxed meal for 20 to 30 Euros plus wine. We have no hesitation in selecting Papadopoli for a friendly, comfortable, romantic stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: A fine location - the hotel is a short walk from the railway station and a shorter one from the Piazzole Roma with its vaporetto stop. But also it is on a picturesque small canal close to the attractive Tre Ponti and with narrow Venetian streets leading to the Campo San Margherita, with abundant good restaurants in these areas. The reception was welcoming and the room had everything we wanted, including a mini-balcony overlooking the Papadopoli gardens. Slightly cramped, perhaps - but this is Venice. Breakfast was copious with an excellent choice. I'd definitely come here again. My only criticism would be that they wouldn't let me play the piano in the foyer. My fingers get a bit twitchy after a few days away from my own piano.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and courteous”
Reviews.Author: misteresperanto
Reviews.Content: An outstanding breakfast guaranteed to set you up for the day - and perhaps even the next one too. If you're a plain tea, rather than a coffee, drinker, you might have to ask for an English breakfast sachet to dangle into your pot of hot water: most of the teas on the table were lemony or earlgreyish. English breakfast, however, was available in the room (but only two pots of coffee creamer - no milk). Our room was round the back - quiet and clean and comfortable. The front of the hotel overlooks a canal and a small square - more like a triangle - which, on one evening, attracted a bunch of noisy youngsters. This might be a problem - but I leave those with front-facing rooms to comment. Staff very friendly and courteous and I would readily return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort itself”
Reviews.Author: DickTravels
Reviews.Content: A long weekend in La Serenissima made special by beautiful weather and this comfortable hotel. Easy to find from the bus or train station at the end of the causeway and overlooking a park and a canal, it was ideal. We'd a good non-smoking room, clean and quiet, helpful staff and superb breakfasts. The map and advice helped and the complimentary water taxi to Murano for expensive glassware and return to St Mark's made a good break from cultural heritage indulgence. Part of a Sunday Times deal with unsocial BA flights which gave 4 days for three nights, this was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our room and staff”
Reviews.Author: LatriciaB
Reviews.Content: We loved our room overlooking one of the smaller canals in Venice. Several hours were spent on the balcony. The hotel staff was excellent - from the front desk to the housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - faultless.”
Reviews.Author: Heather F
Reviews.Content: We had two nights at Papadopoli Hotel. From the moment of our arrival to (sadly), having to leave we could not fault anything about this fantastic establishment. We were greeted by the wonderful, friendly Francesco who made us extremely welcome. During the course of our stay Franesco was extremely helpful, warm an absolute delight to deal with. Our room was superb, decor totally appropriate, cleanliness perfect. A nice touch was a personalized note welcoming us with a box of biscotti in our room. Another bonus was not having to drag our bags far from the carpark. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5*Hotelreviewer
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what else to add to the comments already posted. Great location near the bus and train station away from the busy tourist areas. Well decorated room with large comfortable bed. All the usual features to be expected from a 4* hotel - mini bar, hairdryer, tea & coffee in room, robes etc. Huge breakfasts with wonderful choice of meat, cheese, fruit, yoghurt and pastries etc. Friendly staff etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel located near to the bus terminal and railway station.”
Reviews.Author: snowdrop5
Reviews.Content: The Papadopoli is a rebrand under Accor's M Gallery range, having previously been a Sofitel. It is located very near to the bus terminal and Santa Lucia railway station. So no need to lug heavy suitcases onto Vaporetto, which is handy as twice I've arrived in Venice to find the Vaporetto staff are on strike. Also handy, if you have got lost in the maze of streets that is Venice as the Piazzale Roma (bus terminal) and Ferrovia (train station) are often signposted. Our room had a nice welcome gift that had been wrapped in typical venetian paper and ribbon. Bathrobes and slippers are standard, and complimentary bottles of water, although these weren't replenished during our stay. They also provide tea and coffee making facilities. There is a small bar downstairs, where we had a complimentary drink, a bowl of fresh strawberries and some typical venetian pastries. Evening turn down service with chocolates, Bathroom supplies: The by Culti and perfumed toilet paper. The lift controls respond to body heat, so don't work when you're wearing gloves, which took a while to work out. Concierge service could have been better, when we want to know if our London airport was closed due to snow, the solution given was to spend 7 Euros on a card to access the internet. We were also advised that no-one was answering the phones at British Airways. A feature I could have guessed from past experience and one reason why we weren't booked on a British Airways flight. Our reservation details, provided details of which airline we were using, so giving me information about British Airways was of no use.

Reviews.Title: “Aweome!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AK7811
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights for our honeymoon and amazing! Everything was great especially a lady at reception with glasses soooo helpful! Clean and comfortable and awesome location! Highly reccomend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what was needed”
Reviews.Author: neiljstewart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Venice for the first time and thought the hotel was a perfect base for our 3 night holiday. After travelling the last thing we would have wanted to do was navigate through the city with our cases, so the location was excellent in that respect. As mentioned its not among the hustle and bustle, but being only a 10 min walk from the Rialto Bridge it's actually well placed if you want to weave your way through the alleyways enjoying the sights as you go. In the evenings it was a good base to find somewhere to eat that was not overpriced as it is down near San Marco. Our room on the 5th floor was great. Lovely size and the bed was excellent. The large balcony was brilliant. We would have loved to have been there in the summer. The view down the canal was beautiful. We had breakfast each morning and it set us up perfectly for a day of walking. The selection was great and the service fantastic. Not sure if it's worth 25â‚¬ so we were glad we included it in our booking, hence getting it at a reduced price. We also used the small bar area and it was lovely. Again the service and attention from the bar staff was just great. The front desk was always helpful and their English was impeccable. Our experience was nothing but positive.

Reviews.Title: “This is what you get”
Reviews.Author: NB3542
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately/Fortunately Venice is a VERY old city. The Sofitel/Papapoli is a small hotel at the outskirt of town. What this gives you is very close transport to the train station. It does not put you in the most desireable part of the city. In fact it's a labyrinth of walking if you want to see what the city really has to offer. Hopefully you won't have traveled to Venice to stay indoors. My room was really really small. Barely enough room to go around the bed - this bed was really comfortable though and the bathroom was amazing. The finishes are all highend, but old. The elevetor is so tiny I nearly freaked out. The breakfast buffett was super good, complete with salumes, fresh breads, and really good coffee. I staeyed about a week here and I enjoyed it, however I didn't pay for it either. . . .

Reviews.Title: “Location! Right on the canal”
Reviews.Author: Traveledbug
Reviews.Content: A splendid 5 star hotel. Located only 10 minutes walk from the main railway station. The hotel is situated in a position which forces you to walk and explore the canals and lane ways of Venice. The hotel is a beautiful property with everything you'd expect from a 4-5 star hotel. Reception was very prompt. Bar and resturant service also very good. I would definitley stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Just Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: 675sherlock675
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel in a fabulous location in a fabulous city. The staff, without exception were brilliant, though we do have to single out the head barman who was exactly what a head barman should be. Well worth its 4 stars. We will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennifer m
Reviews.Content: This is just an amazing little boutique hotel. Lovely common areas, exquisite rooms, and good location if you're coming in by train or car, because it is close to the train station. Venice is such a walking city, that it was fun to take off from the hotel and wind around to the other end. Food was a little stilted and not worth the price. They tried to be chi-chi, but again, not worth it. The breakfast, however, is UNREAL!! Beautiful little dining area and just an unforgettable breakfast to start your day. You will feel very pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kallannee
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel within a stones throw of the bus centre. Breakfast was amazing, with such a variety of food we were astounded by the choice and quality. Staff were really friendly and it didn't seem like anything was too much trouble. The only thing for me was the evening meal wasn't so great but the ambience and comfort outweighed all of that. There are also some great restaurants to be found within 5 mins away. There is also a cheap pizzeria just across if you want a really cheap snack. Definitely would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bettyboopinv
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is the place to stay in Venice. Just over the bridge from the Railway, thru the bus station - so no lugging of suit cases great distances trying to find your hotel in the maze that is Venice. Walking distance to every part of Venice is not taxing, but the ferry stop is a few minutes walk if that is preferred. A welcoming drink introduced us to the cozy bar area. The dining room is very formal but without pretensions. The rooms are decorated in character with the period that Venice implies. Staff were very good, with housekeeping doing an excellent job. Our room overlooked a canal. All in all, this hotel is value for money. Disappointed one staff member told us there would be no fireworks in the square on New Years Eve, but there were, so we had to view them from our immediate area instead of my 11 year old grandson being in the square......disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: gyorgyigurban
Reviews.Content: While planning our trip to Venice for our honeymoon, we decided to stay in a luxury hotel in order to pamper ourselves since you only get married once! Nevertheless, we found this hotel and from the first moment we were welcomed to when we left, it was one of the best experiences we've had in a hotel. Not only is it well located next to the bus terminal and car parks, it is a very luxury hotel and extremely clean. The reception was very friendly and spoke very good English. They gave us maps (without asking) and gave us some tips where to go. Although we mentioned that it was our honeymoon when we booked, we didn't expect any different treatment. However, when we go to the room, we were surprised to see that they had given us a welcome basket with a personalised note. We were on the top floor with a balcony that overlooked the canals! It was a very nice decor that had a type of Victorian feel to it. It was extremely clean and all the bathroom amenities you can think a five star hotel would have, including slippers and bathrobes. When we went out at night and toured the city, upon our return, there was a champagne bottle with a snack for our "first night" as honeymooners! This was such a pleasant surprise that sealed our love for this hotel. The cleaning ladies were also extremely nice and whatever we needed something extra for the bathroom, they would give to us, so don't be afraid to ask. The restaurant is also charming and the food is excellent. Overall, we had one of the best experiences at this hotel and made our honeymoon one to remember. I highly recommend it. Thank you Papadopoli!

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING!”
Reviews.Author: luke k
Reviews.Content: Excellent english speaking staff that were extremely helpful. Location is fantastic. A few minutes walk to the train station, bus station and ferry station, yet a very quiet neighbourhood. Had a balcony room on the 1st floor overlooking the canal. Room was extremely large with huge bed, small sitting area and great size bathroom. Did not eat at the hotel but the barman was fantastic - happy to make something not on the menu and give tourists tips. Although not in the centre of Venice, this hotel is walking distance to all the major sights. Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential but poor service at reception let it down”
Reviews.Author: MS M
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel in December 2011. On the first evening in Venice we recieved fabulous service at check-in (thanks to the lovely young man with a great attitude) - the problem was that if he was not at reception then we recieved terrible service, where you were often ignored or spoken to in a dismissive or rude manner (particularly the older female). It was not a good way to enter and exit the hotel. The hotel is a 20 minute walk (pleasant if the weather is good) from St Marks Square. The rooms however were good for a family of four (two interconnecting rooms) - spacious for Venice - and always clean with housekeeping always preparing the rooms to a high standard. The bar staff were very friendly and happy to assist with general questions about Venice. And there you have it - if you can avoid reception - you may enjoy the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Brizzy_Family Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service from reception and restaurant staff Excellent buffett breakfast Excellent tourist information Excellent location as it is walking distance from main train station (no taxi req'd) and not in a noisy area. Great restaurant and great bar with lots to choose from. Good restaurants for alternative eating nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Papadopoli Venezia, WOW!”
Reviews.Author: PeteWH
Reviews.Content: What an experience! This has to be the most amazing hotel we have ever stayed in. Our visit was brief as we prepared to board a cruise but every aspect of this property was first class, from the service at the front desk,to the porter, the restaurant, the bar, the overall decor, facilities and the hugely convenient location to bis and rail stations, the cruise port and the many attractions of this wonderful city. Would we stay again - you bet we would!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Padadopoli”
Reviews.Author: alina s
Reviews.Content: This hotel was sumptious! Marble floors, heavy dripping chandeliers, quiet, and luxurious. The dining room was beautifully decorated, the food for breakfast was incredible. Every thing you wanted;from cooked eggs,sausages to fruuits, cakes, cereals! All served by quiet, polite and English spoken staff. The bedroom we had overlooked the canal which was stunning. Church bells rang out in the morning, no iother noise at ball. Quiet, comfortable. The beds were so warm and re made daily. There was a kettle,safe, fridge and even mobile phone chargers. Hotel staff were so very kind, and the hotel was within walking distance of Piazza Roma for buses and tickets for the Vaporetta. It was like a set out of a film!

Reviews.Title: “Special Birthday holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in November 2011 and were very pleased with the whole stay of three nights. Very helpful staff at the desk and in the restaurant paticularly regarding our requirement for a gluten free diet where at breakfast the restaurant staff automatically provided gluten free food without being asked. Lovely double aspect room on the second floor with balcony overlooking the canal. Would happily recommend this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Corporategal92
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a nite and we were pleasantly surprised! It's definitely value for the $$. The hotel is very close to the main bus terminal and a good 30-40 minutes walk to the San Marco square. The ambience of the hotel was lovely, room was very cosy and clean. Great personal touches like a "welcome note, with complimentary bottles of water and box of gift wrapped biscotti'. There was also a bed turndown service with some treats. Very rare to find such attention to detail these days. Highly recommend Papadoli.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a honeymoon stay at the hotel, with its great location, fluffy bed, helpful hotel staff restaurant suggestions, and enjoyable breakfast. We would reccomend the hotel, and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we check in 21 nov. and stayed 4 nts at junior suite no 329 suite is around 36 square meter , well furnished ,clean ,well located (opposited side of train station) friendly staff. what is more , definitely I will stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: garyclark14
Reviews.Content: I would ignore any bad reviews, this place is just wonderful. We met Lucio at the reception who was so helpful & gave us lots of tips. So close to the bus station, excellent breakfasts in a wonderful dining room, we were in a junior suite for 3 nights. There are so many good deals at this time of the year including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We just stayed a week at this hotel and we were very pleased with the room (Junior Suite) and the service. The breakfast was particularly outstanding: The staff went out of their way to make sure that we had everything we wanted and, in particular, that the buffet was well stocked with fresh delicacies. It did remind us of the type of service one gets in top class hotels in Asia! The location of the hotel is ideal for arrival and departure in Venice. Daytime public transport connections with the center are excellent; evening outings need a bit of advance planning regarding transport. Distances in Venice are however short and one can walk anytime back to the hotel from, say, St Marcus Square. Customers who are not familiar with Venice would probably appreciate if the hotel would provide more advice or literature.

Reviews.Title: “It's close to the train station!”
Reviews.Author: Vinny102
Reviews.Content: One big plus is this hotel is located next to the train station. Since All the taxis are boats it was helpful to be able walk to the hotel. The walk to st marks basilica isn't bad bring a map though walking anywhere in Venice is an adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Blissful”
Reviews.Author: pukekhoAuckland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our last few days in Italy. Our room was magnificent, housekeeping great and we had a balcony from which we could see fantastic sunrises. The staff were great, the location perfect and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location close to Pizzale Roma and cruise terminal. It is truly a 5 star hotel and we were able to travel directly to the entrance by water taxi from the airport. The staff were very friendly and our room very comfortable. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “COMFY BED”
Reviews.Author: dj64 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - rooms are quite small but the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in!!!! The pillows were soft and cosy. Breakfast was very good as there was a great selection of food and the restaurant is absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: pat s
Reviews.Content: This is a really good 4* hotel in Venice. Very convenient for the station, the airport buses and the vaporetto stop. Not too far to pull the suitcase when you arrive and only one large bridge to cross. Friendly helpful staff who speak excellent english and a lovely large double room and spotless bathroom with all amenities overlooking the small canal outside. Beautifully clean with linen and towels changed every day. Minibar, safe, internet & TV. Very quiet and no noise from neighbouring rooms. Nothing was too much trouble. Large airy restaurant for breakfast in the mornings - plenty of choice of hot or cold, fresh fruit, meats, cheese etc. Try to book breakfast as part of the deal and not separately as it can be rather expensive. Plenty of small restaurants nearby and easy and safe to travel into the centre and St Marco etc. It is not a cheap hotel but well worth paying the extra for comfort and accessibility. A good choice too for single travellers. Very highly recommended. Venice can be cold in mid-October and wet so essential to take some warm clothes and good walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, well priced and solid service”
Reviews.Author: WinePleaze
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2010 (yes delayed review). We were driving through Europe so needed a quality hotel, central to Venice and nearby parking. This hotel was just about perfect for our needs. . Parking is easy (read expensive) to sort out in the main parking station which is not more than 10minutes walk away, please just make sure your bags are on rollers because you have to get them to the Hotel yourself. Hotel is very authentic to the style expected of Venice, its a short walk from the Main Canal. Room was clean, well appointed, very comfortable and a lovely view from the windows. Service at Front desk was exceptional, Concierge was professional and helpful to ensure we avoided some of the tourist traps which abound. Best advice for Venice: 1. Take a compass so you can at least get your directions, the path you take is not important, just the general direction and every trip will be a wonderful discovery. 2. In our experience food in venice is generally not great, you have to search it out and the best will be expensive. We only ate Breakfast in the Hotel and it was good, not memorable 3. Dont be afraid to try the bright orange drinks you see everywhere at Sunset, called Aperol Spritz and an essential and highly addictive part of the Venician Experience. 4. May was a brilliant time to travel. November an apparent disaster due to tides 5. Pay for a gondola in the smaller canals and chose someone with personality and who can sing you wont forget that experience. We almost auditioned 4 guys and found a gem! At the end of the day, Venice is not so much about the Hotel, you just want something that gives location and value and I would to this Hotel return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good for post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: AllyGGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We arrived from cruise ship early morning and rooms were not available. Concierge arranged for a group of us to take a complimentary taxi to Murano for a tour of a glass factory and said we would be dropped back at St Mark's square. She gave us maps and showed how to get back to the hotel by which time our rooms would be ready. This was much better than hanging around waiting for rooms,and worked fine for us. (One elderly couple were dropped off at nearest point of 'mainland' by their taxi driver, so be sure to check this before return) Room in hotel was clean and comfortable, and breakfast was excellent. We did not eat in the hotel, since there were plenty of canal side restaurants nearby, although friends who did were disappointed that the food did not match the ambience of the dining area. The hotel is a short stroll from bus, train and vaporetto at Piazzale Roma. Good value for Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gybigguy Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to the train station, the cruise docks, Piazzale Roma and the Grand Canal. Service was good, not excellent. The room was well appointed and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large and well appinted. Room temperature was good and easily set. My complaint is the price which was very high relative to other times. Pre-cruise price gauging reduces the value of this property and in spite of it's convenience, I would not recommend it if another good property could be found for less money. Price at other times (non-cruise) is right in line with other good properties. There have been comments that this was a Soffitel and no longer is. Actually, this is part of the Accor Hotel chain, as is Soffitel, but it has been moved to the Mgallery class.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent location, terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: WAWWNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel pre cruise in September 2011. This was our first trip to Venice and we were not disappointed. The check in was quick and efficient, the staff very helpful and provided a map for our use. The room beautiful - ours overlooked the Papadopoli gardens. The location of the hotel is perfect - very close to the vaporetto station - our first order of business was to get on the vaporetto and take it to San Marco via the Grand Canal - I had a guide book which described every building of importance - hint: go the back of the vaporetto to see the sights unencumbered. Our room was beautiful, very comfortable and very clean. I loved the bath tub - huge and deep - just right for soaking in after a long day of sightseeing and traveling! The buffet breakfast was plentiful and delicious - the staff, again, very professional and helpful. When we return to Venice we will most assuredly in this hotel. The location (within easy walking distance to the train station) is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Another Faultless Stay !”
Reviews.Author: SurreyNavigator
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed many stays at this hotel over the years, remembering it as previously a Pullman, then a Sofital and now branded by Accor as an MGallery Collection hotel. The position is exceptional for ease of transport. There are inexpensive express coaches from the airport and the main vaporetti terminus is very close but does not impinge on the peacefullness of the hotels location. Standards in the hotel are very high and the staff is excellent - we have recently stayed in several 5 star establishments which would struggle to compete.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the bus station”
Reviews.Author: Jmonty26
Reviews.Content: Great location for getting to the airport- we stayed here 2 nights before departing Venice. The surrounding area is nice- lot of shopping and restaurants. Room was clean and the biggest we had seen in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Papadopoli is great !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very well located top class hotel with great facilities and staff. Would highly recommend to anyone.Rooms were very clean and had great views of the canal on all sides. Fantastic shops and close to Train station and Bus Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Heschposito
Reviews.Content: We ended our vacation with one night in Venice. While the location is quite a walk to the Piazza San Marco and the main attractions we were very pleased as it was off the beaten path. We were taking the train the next day which made it extremely convenient for a short stay. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. Very comfortable bed. The bathroom was in great need of an overhall however, it was clean. The front desk staff was wonderful however the barstaff could use an attitude adjustment. Breakfast was also really great. We enjoyed our stay and Venice was a great way to end our trip and left us wanting more.

Reviews.Title: “Transportation Close But...”
Reviews.Author: Chicago55Chicago
Reviews.Content: ...a more realistic half hour walk to St. Peters Square. And the bathrooms have very tall step-in tub/shower combos that are not for the elder traveler. That said, it is a lovely ornate hotel often used by the cruise lines for the extra night's stay in Venice. Be sure to get the rate which includes the nice buffet breakfast, as it is about $50dollars to eat there otherwise. There is no room service, but a bar in the lobby.Also, no free Wi-Fi and a new additional ten euro city hotel tax that they tag on whether you have prepaid or not. In all, not a place anyone stays more than a night or two, but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “When in Venice - WOW!”
Reviews.Author: ChiTraveler_11
Reviews.Content: By far one of the nicest places we stayed in Italy. Extremely helpful service, very attentive staff in the dining and bar areas, and our room was extremely clean with fantastic beddings/linens. Literally a 3 minute walk to the bus station (one ticket for an express bus to the airport is 5 euro per person and it only took 20 minutes - much cheaper than paying 60 euro per person to take the boat taxi. The train station is also another 5 minutes away. Even though you are close to the main transport to get you in and out of Venice, you would never know it. The hotel is surrounded by a canal and beautiful park with a romantic bridge right next to it. So while it's on the far east side of Venice, we would definitely return here. I cannot say enough great things about this place. Gratzi! It's worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: RHNIreland
Reviews.Content: We loved our hotel in Venice. It was beautifully decorated and our room was very spacious. The staff were all very helpful and we received lots of practical information that really helped us with our plans for our brief trip there. Location wise we found the hotel very handy for everything. You're very close to the main tourist sites but you are also away from the crowds. Overall a lovely hotel and one I would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: danmar169
Reviews.Content: We'd endorse the positive comments elsewhere. The location so close to Pzle Roma and the Grand Canal is great and there are plenty of really good eating and drinking options within a short walk. We booked directly with Accor which seemed to have the best rate which included breakfast; the room was a canal room with balcony (just enough for two) which looked across the canal and was comofrtably furnished; cleanliness was impeccable and the public areas are nicely presented thought they tended to be quiet (which wasn't a problem); the bar was great for an end of evening nightcap or a pre-dinner spritz and staff throughout the hotel were courteous, freindly and helpful. Breakfast was the buffet found (though plus some hot items) in most Italian Hotels though we thought the slection and quality was better than others we'd encountered; the restauarant was actually very good though over-priced and not used by guests. We obviously can't compare this with anywhere else in Venice but we really did like the place very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good Venice Location”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel which is getting somewhat dated. However, the rooms were large by Venice standards and the staff were exceptional. The Canal view rooms are lovely with a balcony and the rooms are sound proofed to avoid noise from the square below. There is ample choice in Venice, but if you want a reliable and comfortable hotel in a great location then I would highly recommend the Papadopoli Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but the balcony upgrade made the difference.”
Reviews.Author: Dave W
Reviews.Content: This was booked for our silver wedding trip and I am so glad we upgraded the room to superior double with canal view. We were given a room with a a large balcony to sit out and watch Venice go by, this made for a superior experience.Looking at the hotel from th outside it appeared that there were only four rooms with this facility (One for each floor) The hotel itself is very close to the bus station, this made for a easy transfer. Do not underestimate this, as we watched lots of travellers carrying luggage all over Venice, and they didn't look happy! Another advantge of the location is that you are close to the canal bus terminus. The room itself was fine, with good facilities, and a large, comfortable king size bed. We did not take breakfast in the hotel, as we thought that 50 euros for both of us was obscene, so we did what the Italians do and found a coffee shop for coffee & a croissant for 5-10 euros. The hotel did not seem to have too many facilities justifying it's 4 star rating, but as we were in Venice, we never intended to stay in the hotel much anyway. As far as location is concerned the downside to the fact that the hotel is near to the bus station, is that it is quite a distance to St Mark's Square, about 30 minutes walk. Highly recommended, but i'm not sure we would have enjoyed it as much had we not had the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “First stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location - close to water and bus/taxi transport, as well as the ship terminal. Ate in several of the close by restaurants and good food throughout. Had a small but a very comfortable bar lounge area. Hotel desk staff was responsive to several questions and quite helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Balcony Room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel fronting Tolentini Canal and Papadopoli Gardens. Top floor room with large balcony overlooking extensive areas of Venice and gardens. Hotel is within easy walking distance of Piazzale Roma (direct bus access to and from airport) and close to people mover for cruise passengers. Room provided good facilities (slightly dated). In the morning from our balcony we were able watch numerous cruise liners sailing along the Giudecca Canal to the cruise terminals (including the "Neuw Amsterdam" which we joined that day for the start of a Mediterranean Cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: FernandoGomes
Reviews.Content: If you donÂ´t want to stay very close to the St. Mark.s area and you donÂ´t want to walk a lot with lugage and stuff. Stay at the Papadoli. The rooms are very confortable, the breakfest is realy good, and there is a lot of litle good restaurants around. And if you want a really good tip: Forget about St.MarkÂ´ Square. Venice is much more than a really crowded square. But if you really need to go there, the vaporetos or water taxis are a short steps away at Piazale Roma.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: executive
Reviews.Content: We spent two most enjoyable nights at The Papadopoli. The location for us was perfect, we did not want to be in the hussle and bussle of the St.Mark's area all the time and it was so enjoyable strolling the back streets and enjoying Venice along with the Venetians where they both lived and shopped. The hotel is well situated for restaurants and shopping. When we were too tired to walk back to the hotel we just made our way to the nearest Vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal and took the water bus back to the Santa Lucia railway station and then it was only a couple of minutes stroll away. The staff were most accommodating, friendly and helpfull. Our room was bright and cheerful looking out over the walkway past the Papadopoli gardens to the Piazzale Roma. The bed was most comfortable and the bathroom large , very clean with pleasant amenities and large, fluffy bath robes . We did not eat at the hotel, but the Winter Garden looked exquisite and the bar was very inviting. Nevertheless, we enjoy exploring, and we found many very good restaurants just a short walk away and the tiny wine bar on the other side of the canal became a regular stop. We were taking a cruise departing from Venice and the hotel was so convenient to the new People Mover monorail in Piazzale Roma just a short walk over the bridge. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Venice and recommend the Papadopoli highly. It will be our first choice for a hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: TandMHDev
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Venice after 12 years, and the hotel proved to be everything that the Tripadvisor reviews had said. This time we travelled via Air Miles. We had stayed at the Antico Panada close to St Marks Square on our first visit and the TripAdvisor rankings of the two hotels proved accurate. Although the Panada was nearer to the hub of the main tourist attractions, the Papadopoli was more convenient for the transport links into and out of the city, being close to the main bus station (Piazzale Roma) and the train terminus (Ferrovia Santa Lucia). Most of the vaporetto routes stop at Piazzale Roma so it was easy to get to most of the points of interest. Having said that, walking to the Rialto bridge and St Markâ€™s square is never arduous, and regularly signposted. The location of the hotel is in a quiet district of the city, so we were not disturbed during the night. We arrived via the ATVO coach from Marco Polo airport at about midday and were told that our room would be available at 2pm, which it was. The reception staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. We had a double room on the first floor, and although the view was over the curved glass roof of the dining room, it wasnâ€™t unpleasant, and we could see the trees in the background. In our opinion, we only use it as a place to sleep, so didnâ€™t place too much importance in a good view. Those that do, could pay more for a room with a view over the canal. Both the room and the bathroom were large, clean and tidy. The bed was king size and very comfortable, and the pillows were very soft so that you sank into them. The air conditioning operated effectively, and the fan was unobtrusive. Although they donâ€™t mention it on their website, there was tea and coffee making facilities in the room. We used the WiFi in the room at â‚¬7 for 3 hours use, but this can be extended at reception without further charge. It proved reliable and efficient. The hotel also has a computer for internet use which is connected to a printer â€“ we found it useful for printing our return flight boarding passes. The Breakfast menu would suit most tastes with cereal, fruit, juices, croissants, scrambled egg, sausage and bacon, and various cold savouries. Disappointingly there wasnâ€™t sliced bread and a toaster. The Dining Room staff were quietly efficient, removing used crockery and cutlery immediately it was finished. The Papadopoli is a great hotel, and we would recommend it to others and would certainly stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: JimR3
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Papadopoli. Very nice room, small by American standards, but reasonable by European. Hotel is located several hundred yards from Piazza Roma which makes transportation to or from the airport a breeze. If driving to Venice the parking garages at Piazza Roma are a must, this also where all rental car offices are located. The hotel is located on the opposite side of the island from St Mark's but the mentioned conveniences overcome that distance rather easily. Hotel is adjacent to a park, there is a COOP supermarket nearby, and one of the main vaporetto stops is just a few hundred yards away. Our room was very quiet as was the area, but there are numerous nearby restaraunts, bars, cafes, and shopping. Hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. Only negative was the firmness of the mattress which was overcome by placing the comforter under the bottom sheet.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel on Our Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 weeks in Europe for our honeymoon. A few days in Rome, Florence and Venice, and then a week in Paris. The Papadopoli Venice was, by far, the BEST hotel on our trip. King-size bed, fluffy pillows and comforter, large/clean bathroom, and perfect location. The location was great--just a short walk from the train station and close to the water taxi. Quiet area; friendly staff. Close to a laundromat. It was awesome; when we go back, we are going to definitely stay there again. Oh, and the breakfast that was included was AMAZING. Delicious breads, fresh fruits, eggs/bacon. There was even a day that we were late for breakfast, and the waitstaff grabbed a tray and filled it with coffee, tea, croissants and juice...they definitely went out of their way to provide excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Very attentive service and advice. We loved the authenticity of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ERob_11
Reviews.Content: Venice is magical by itself but it makes a big difference when you have friendly & useful advice given getting around given can be difficult! The rooms are surprisingly big and comfortable beds...bliss!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect location with a high level of service”
Reviews.Author: CaptainMiles
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic for our visit to Venice. We were arriving by car, which is bound to be a problem in Venice. Not with this hotel. We were able to easily find a free 15-minute parking spot on Piazzale Roma, and it was easy to walk to the hotel with luggage, check in, and be back at the car within 15 minutes. Only one easy bridge to cross with the luggage. Perfect location. The location was also great for the vaporetto, airport bus, the train station, everything. And because there are signs throughout Venice for the Piazzale Roma and the train station, finding your way back to the hotel from anywhere is real easy. We has a room overlooking the canal, which was just sweet, especially in the early mornings and evenings. We were offered a welcome cocktail in their bar, which was an extra nice touch. The staff was always very helpful. Absolutely perfect. Would stay here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean hotel but rude and lazy staff”
Reviews.Author: baileytheragdoll1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four days and never got the same answer twice when asking for directions or information, in fact we got wrong directions several times. The staff acted very put out when approached for anything. We asked for an iron one evening and were told irons are fire hazzards and would not be given out to guests. They wanted us to pay them to iron for us. Everything here costs extra, so beware. The hotel is not convenient to anything in Venice, but is one of the closer ones to the train station. Restaurant is expensive but so is everything in Venice. The a/c worked well and the rooms were clean and updated. We had several issues with clogged drains but are pretty used to that in Europe. Overall, we liked the hotel, just didn't care for the staff and their lack of interest in their guests. They know most people won't be back and that Venice is a one time trip for most and they could care less about helping you or making your stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, great location for pre/post cruising”
Reviews.Author: YYZtraveller33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papadopoli Venice for a couple of nights before leaving on a Med Cruise. I would highly reccomend this hotel for anyone visiting Venice. From the time we got off of the Airport Express bus in The Piazza Roma until we'd checked into the hotel was less than a 5 min. walk. We only had to pull our luggage over one small bridge. The check-in process went very smoothly and we were shown to our room which looked back towards the Piazza Roma and the cruise terminal. The bed was probably the most comfortable we slept on during our whole holiday (cruise, and Paris). There is a small cafe just across from the hotel that my wife and I would get coffee at in the morning just to people watch. The hotel is a little ways from the main attractions in Venice, but the walk to St. Mark's Square was very enjoyable(Sting was giving a concert in the square on the night we were there) Again, we very much enjoed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting Venice. CIAO

Reviews.Title: “An excellent gateway into Venice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within a stone's throw of the Piazzale Roma, so getting the bus from Marco Polo Airport was not a problem - we didn't have to carry our bags through Venice's narrow streets! The hotel itself was impressive, with very helpful staff at the desk who provided a free map of the city (which is something of a must!). It's location is slightly out of the city centre, but well within walking distance and very close to a couple of water-bus stops if you don't feel like walking! The room was clean, nicely decorated with plenty of tabletops, a well stocked mini-bar, television with lots of channel choices (over 100) and two telephones. There was a wardrobe that was not in the way (incorporating a safe) and the bathroom was also clean and stocked with plenty of towels and mini toiletries. Even though the restaurant at the hotel served excellent food, we decided to try a couple of other eateries within staggering distance of the hotel - there were plenty to choose from. All in all, I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Everything was well in place to make our stay in this truly beautiful city complete.

Reviews.Title: “One night stop over.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Three couples (grandparents, parents and two early twenties children) stayed at the hotel for a one day and night stop over before joining a cruise ship. The hotel met our every expectation for location, quality of accommodation, friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Would not hesitate to use the hotel again and hopefully next time for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go for Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Tennessee50plus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convienent for people catching cruise ships and the rooms or ok. We upgraded to a suite which overlooked the canal which was nice. The desk staff are not overly friendly for what the rooms cost. Our worse surprise was when we went for what looked like a typical continental breakfast. Rolls, coffe, juice, muffins, yougart etc. Nothing exceptional. Nowhere was there a mention of a charge for the breakfast. The menu at the entrance made no mention of a price. When we sat down and started to eat the waiter made no mention of a charge. Only when we were done eating our muffins and yougart were we presented with a charge that was the equivalent to $35 per person. When we complained to the front desk about the lack of any mention of the cost for the breakfast, we were curtly told that it was posted on the back of our room door. WHO looks on the door to see what breakfast cost. That put a damper on what was an otherwise wonderful trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother -- NOT 4 star”
Reviews.Author: natter1327
Reviews.Content: While this was the only 4 star hotel we stayed at on a 5 city tour of Italy (the rest were 3 star), it was the worst one and the only one I would never return to. Yes, the hotel is pretty, the beds are comfortable, and they have several English speaking channels (if you want to watch TV on vacation...)but it is not worth it! First of all, the Wifi was 7 Euros for 3 hours. Okay this is not that expensive, but hotels nowadays should have free wifi...it doesn't cost them any extra to provide it to the guests. All the 3 stars we stayed at in other cities had free Wifi. Second of all, the breakfast was HIGHWAY ROBBERY at 25 Euros each. Again, all the 3 stars provided a lovely, FREE breakfast. There was no way (even if I had 25 Euros to burn) that I would pay that for a breakfast. Bar staff was RUDE!!!! It clearly said in the pamphlet that they would serve you ice. My husband and I tried to get one glass of ice apiece on a particularly hot afternoon and he would only give us one glass to share!! And this is supposed to be 4 star service? The other hotels we stayed at were more than happy to give us ice whenever we wanted! Location is good to the train station, but not really to anything else. Overall, don't bother with Hotel Papadopoli...stay somewhere cheaper with a star or two less where you will receive MUCH better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel pity about the bar staff”
Reviews.Author: Curtp23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week, and found the hotel not too far from the station to carry your bags and close to some attractions. For a 60 cent chardonnay go across the road to the little bar, you will find your host much more accomodating than the scowling barman at the hotel. The hotel promotes its apertivos and what you get is a barman more interested in hiding around the corner texting his friends than serving the customer. Its a pity because concierge go out of their way to assist you, but why pay $17 Euro for a bad scowl.

Reviews.Title: “Is worth writing another excellent review?”
Reviews.Author: RintintinPraha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely great. Location, service and above all beds. The bed was just great. We had 5th floor room with terrace and the view was just stunning. The only little issue is really those â‚¬25 for lousy breakfast but all Venice is kindda expensive, isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and we'd use it again”
Reviews.Author: NoahsGranandGrandpa
Reviews.Content: This is part of the Accor group (formerly a Sofitel & that name is still at the top of the building) Very convenient for the bsu station after the shuttle bus from the airport. Just one bridge over a canal and a 2 minute walk to arrive. Also round the corner from part of the Grand Canal so handy for the vaperetti Friendly staff, excellent breakfast. Lovely room but unfortunately the people previously in the room had smoked in it so there was a stale smoke aroma for the first day although the cleaning staff did their best. Hotel was full as it was Carnival Week so we couldn't get moved.

Reviews.Title: “Ah Venice”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: What a place. Hotel is a short walk from the train station, which was a blessing as walking around Venice with a suit case is no easy task. It was a bit of a walk to St Peter's square but it is so nice to wander through the streets and explore this wonderful city. Gondala ride is expensive and disapointing but must be done. Hotel was really nice, staff friendly and room was as a nice size.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear..”
Reviews.Author: B00Tee
Reviews.Content: An ex Sofitel and it was tired, smelled bad, was dark and lacklustre - such a disappointment. The staff at the reception were at first brusque and then tried to be helpful. Didn't see though why I should have to show my room key in order to get a free (and inaccurate) tourist map of Venice from them. Breakfast was 25 euros per person on top of the cost of the room so the restaurant was empty in the morning - and appeared to empty in the evening as well. We were not tempted to eat there and the staff seemed quite apologetic about the cost. Rather depressing overall.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Andrey_Buzin
Reviews.Content: That's a really good hotel. The only drawback I could remember was breakfast price. 25 euro per person is too much. The hotel is conveniently located near bus stor and railway station. Of course there is no problem to walk to a vaporetto berth to travel around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than expected, the rooms, service and comfort was absolutely fabulous. So much so that I just had to take numerous photographs of the room before any of the wonderful sights of Venice. Right from checking in to departure a pleasurable experience which I do not hesitate to recommend to anybody. Best choice of hotel if intending to stay in Venice. (even if it is only one night - well worth every cent)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: alfromlarbert
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location and excellent service. A bit away from St Marks but just beside the Ferrovia so plenty going on. Only had breakfast but was always good. Staff could not be more helpful and they could all speak perfect English. Has it's own jetty so ideal for water taxi transfers and you are only yards from vaparretto stops for all locations.

Reviews.Title: “Italy and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our last stay was in this hotel and I fell in love with Venice. Wish we could have had lomger. having a room with a balcony overlooking a canal was great for atmosphere. Great to have tea and coffe making as most european hotels did not provide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Greal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in July 2011. The rooms were beautiful and extremely clean. The front desk helped book dinner reservations for two nights and were very friendly. Two minute walk to Piaazalle Roma to catch early buses to airport. Overall great location and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice of hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Peltt
Reviews.Content: The M Gallery Papadopoli hotel is a really easy one to find if you enter Venice on the airport express coach, as you have to pull your suitcases only a short walk from the coach stop to its front door. It is also very handy for the main boat stops when setting of on travels around Venice and the other islands. The building is painted in a traditional terracotta which blends in well with the general Venetian architecture. It is on a narrow canal, with gardens to the side. Our room looked onto the canal at the front and had a pleasant view onto neighbouring buildings. There was a lot of noise outside at night which could be a disturbance, as the open area was a gathering spot for local youths. The sounds of the people in the room above could also be heard as clearly as if they were in the room with you. Our room was very attractively decorated and furnished in traditional style and had a sofa as well as the large bed. The bathroom was especially attractive in design and with posh toiletries. The restaurant room was the highlight of the hotel, with its walls lined with cork and full of exotic climbing plants. We particularly enjoyed the very comfortable bar and lounge, which had a nice range of interesting books, cosy seats and felt a welcoming space to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: m0ttey
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night into the bus station in Venice and were amazed to find the hotel only a few minutes walk away. The reception staff were so helpful in advising us how to get around in Venice and in booking restaurants for us in the evenings. The room was much larger than we expected, the bed was comfy and it was quiet at night. We left Venice via the train and whilst this was the other side of the Grand Canal, again it was easy enough to walk too with our luggage. We would return here again for its service, accessibility and quietness.

Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful breakfast...would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: NifT33
Reviews.Content: This is a former Sofitel of Venice so it is a more upscale property; clean and well maintained. It is situated fairly near the train (Station St Lucia) and bus (Piazalle Roma) stations but across the Grand Canal and in a park like setting with large trees. It is in a very relaxing and quaint area. The entrance is tricky as it is away from the Grand Canal but still on a waterway. There are shops and some great restaurants very close by as well. The breakfast and dining area is amazing. Decorated like a park or jungle with trees and vines scaling a trellis, it was quite wonderful. The food was fresh, there was quite a variety of juices, fruit, you name it. Plenty to eat and delicious! Some people looking to be in the hustle and bustle of the main path to San Marco Square (Piazza San Marco) might not like this quieter area but we were close enough to to the main path to get there easily. Plus, it was very nice not having to haul our luggage from the train to the other side of Venice through narrow and crowded corridors. We were very pleased with this hotel and would definitely stay again. One word of caution to the first time visitor to Venice. The maps are very confusing. Some streets have the same name but are not connected together and travel in a different direction from another of the same name. Some "boroughs" have visible and up to date signs to help you find your way and others do not have signs posted at all. The people there are very kind and will help you find your way if you get turned around. We actually enjoyed "getting lost" and found some wonderful alleys and buildings. One recommendation for those staying more than one day: We found a Leonardo da Vinci exhibit that was amazing. We stumbled across it on one of our 'got lost off the trail again' moments. We are so glad we did too! It was Informative and well presented with some interactive displays as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - Andres!”
Reviews.Author: ZJTSydney
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in Venice. The rooms were typically Italian in style. Generally clean and everything was fully functional. It is not too far from where you would set off from either your bus or train (so you wont be carrying luggage too far) however you are 15-20mins stroll from the main sites of Venice but that is the best part about Venice, simply strolling the streets and getting lost. Wifi was a little expensive but then what isnt in Venice. We were very lucky to meet Andres at reception who was particularly accommodating. He took the time to explain the what and where. The buffet breakfast was nice and there was always a large variety. The only negative is that all the carpet does bring on minor allergies, like sneezing. I also heard another patron making the same comment.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & super location”
Reviews.Author: Neese50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid June 2011 with my husband. My first ever visit to Venice and I booked the trip via lastminute, having checked out the hotel via trip advisor. Hotel was great - staff very friendly and helpful. We arrived at hotel at 12 noon and to our surprise and delight we were able to go straight to our de-luxe room. Room was everything we wanted, lovely view on to canal and very comfortable. Lovely white duvet/sheets and towels, very clean and good for all amenities, kettle, safe, hairdrier, lovely bath robes, range of toiletries etc. On day we left we were able to leave our bags somewhere safe til we left in the evening - all very helpful. Excellent turn down service you could always get extra towels/toiletries if needed. Breakfast was included in what we paid and it was excellent - lovely spot to sit in the indoor winter garden and the normal selection of eggs,meat, cheese, cereals, juices, breads, cakes, fruits etc Huge selection. Hotel is in the Sante Croce area. So very easy to get in from airport, we took express (5 euros each) bus to bus station (Piazzle Roma) and then a short (less than 5 mins) walk from bus station. 5 mins walk to the Vaporetti (Piazzale Roma) stops where you can take Line 1 or 2 down to San Marco area or wherever you want to go to. We were in Venice for 4 days and bought a Venice card costing 33 Euros for the 3 days - well worth it, but beware does not include the express airport bus. We knew the hotel was not right in the centre of things but we appreciated that - it was easy to walk to local restaurants - recommended by hotel staff. Quiet cafes nearby. Our only criticism was that whilst we were in Venice, there was the Venice Regatta on the Sunday which meant changes/cancellations to the Vaporetti lines but the hotel staff did not warn us of this, I just happened to overhear someone talking. Considering most people staying in hotel were tourists this seemed a little odd. Caterine on reception desk seemed especially vague about what boats were running. We enjoyed many of the sights - tip for older travellers - take ID to get a senior reduction on entry fees. Our only disappointment was that we could not get to Murano - due to Regatta. A must is the Doge's Palace - fantastic place. View from the Bell Tower in San Mark's square - quite stunning. Loved the Zattere area - take the No 2 direction Tronchetto - takes you via the cruise ships and past Giudecca Island past Zattere and on to St Mark's - a good alternative to going down the Grand Canal. We love Venice and if we ever came back would have no hesitation in staying again here - the old Sofitel hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Diego, the Front Desk Manager, is the best!!”
Reviews.Author: cymluv
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the reviews and the proximity of the hotel to the airport bus stop (about 2-3 minutes walk). Unfortunately, when we arrived at the hotel, we discovered that otel.com had cancelled our reservation without our knowledge. We were informed by Diego, the fron desk manager, that there were no rooms available at the hotel or anywhere else in Venice because of the art festival. We didn't panic, but put ourselves in the capable hands of Diego, who was determined to help us. He sent us to the bar for a glass of wine on the house while he looked for a room at one of the other hotels. Through perserverance, Diego was finally able to find a room for us at another hotel on the isle of Giudecca, which is across the Grand Canal from Venice. He also informed us that if we wanted to come back to the Papadopoli, he had a room available the next night . We stayed at the Papadopoli the next night and the room was very nice, well decorated and cozy. Diego even sent some cookies to our room as a welcome gift. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone as the staff is superb. Also, the hotel is located at the opposite end of Venice and you get a view of a different side of Venice. There is a very trendy square (Campo Santa Marguerita) nearby which has lots of bars, restaurants, etc. One word of advice, we were told that the airport bus leaves at 5:00 a.m. We arrived at the bus stop about 4:40 a.m. and as soon as we got on, the bus left for the airport. So make sure you get to the bus stop at 4:30 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautifully furnished”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its quick getaway from Venice to the airport. Service was good and the bed was super comfy! We enjoyed the premium room overlooking the canal. The night manager was surprised when we checked out very early to catch the first airport bus, but he recovered and we left with no problems. We will consider using it again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: FRANKD_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Excellent..Hotel staff very professional....Near train station in non tourist area.Easy to get all over Venice...

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at Hotel Papadopoli Venice”
Reviews.Author: Neal_Glenda Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Papadopoli Hotel, Venice for three nights. The hotel more than met our expectations, the staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and well serviced. The hotel is located only a short distance from the Railway station, but you do have to walk up and down steps over two bridges to get there. If you can drag your luggage with you (we did) then you will save yourself a lot of money. There is a park adjacent to the hotel - this is a real bonus because there is very little grass/greenery in Venice. The hotel is also only a couple of minutes from the Piazzale Roma (the bus terminal). You can get a bus to Marco Polo Airport from there for only 5 euro per person (including luggage). The hotel is about a 30 minute walk to San Marco Square (if you don't stop to look at all the shops on the way). A ferry takes about 15 minutes along the Grand Canal, and is a pleasant way to see the buildings along the way.

Reviews.Title: “A Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: finsth
Reviews.Content: We just loved this place. Only minutes from the bus and train stations so no need to cart your bags all around the canals to reach your hotel. Lovely corner room larger than most European hotels. A great rate for Venice included breakfast. A first class Accor hotel (former Sofitel). Everything about the room was lovely. European elegance with modern fixtures. Clean and classy.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay at Papadopoli Venice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We had excellent service while we were there. The hotel is conveniently located close to the main train station and bus to the airport. We would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trudi2 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on line based on otherTrip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. After a long flight from the states we arrived about 10 AM and were told our room was ready for us and we could check in immediately allowing us to freshen up. The hotel is convenient to the taxi drop off and train station and is a very short walk across one bridge. Unfortunately we were to late for breakfast at the hotel and ate at a marginal cafe across the street. From the hotel we were able to walk to everything or take the Vaporetto which took more time because of the volume of people due to a banking holiday. The hotel staff was very helpful, our bed was comfortable after a long day of walking and breakfast was a delight. We would definitely stay here again. J&C, Chester Springs, PA, USA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Older hotel, Great Location for trips”
Reviews.Author: genat
Reviews.Content: This was the end of our Rome-Florence-Venice trip and the last hotel in Italy. This hotel is a 10 minutes walk from the train station. You will have to wheel your bags over two bridges so if you have a lot of luggage you should know that ( We only had two carry-on bags) This hotel is older but in a very good condition. The staff makes you feel welcome and go out of their way to help. It was raining hard when we arrived to Venice and we got completely soaked when we got to the hotel. When I called front desk to ask if we can get rain boots the woman offered us to borrow rain boots for the two of us - such a nice gesture so we don't have to run around trying to buy them in a unfamiliar city, I would like to thank her for that - her name was Caterina - thank you! ( sorry if I misspelled the name) The bed was the best out of the three hotels we stayed in this trip. The linens feel high-thread count cotton - very pleasant. The hotel provides all the pillows and blankets you may want plus the bath ropes, slippers, etc, etc - very nice. The breakfast was good. Overall it feels that this hotel knows that t may be on the older side but they are trying very hard to compensate for it with excellent service, good linens, - small things but very helpful. Oh - this was the only hotel that provided electric kettle in the room so we can make tea and coffee in the room - thank you for small miracles! Don't know if the fire code in Venice is different from other places but this was very welcome, The location is 5 minutes walk to Pl. De Roma vaporetto station. We took a bunch of side trips to Venetian lagune - Murano island, Burano island - this location was great to catch the vaporetto and go whenever we wanted. Vaporetto is a water bus that takes you around Venice. Also when it was sadly time for us to leave Venice we walked 5 minutes to Pl. De Roma bs station and took express bus to the airport - 5 EURO per person, 20 min to the airport. Overall we liked this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Breester03
Reviews.Content: A two day stay in Venice was the last stop of our 2 week trip through Italy. We stayed one night at the Hotel Papadopoli, so we did not have an opportunity to enjoy all of the hotel's many attributes. We were scheduled to stay 2 nights there but the website that we used screwed up our prepaid reservations. Diego, the front desk manager, and the hotel's reservations operator were extremely helpful getting to the bottom of the website's mishap and arranging for us to stay at another hotel for one night (which was no easy feat since Venice was sold out due to the biennial art festival then ongoing). The hotel's location is excellent. We had a 7 am departure flight so needed a hotel within a few minutes walk of the bus station - we got on a 4:40 am bus and were at the airport in 20 minutes. The hotel was also easy to reach the first day when we arrived at the train station. A walk over 2 bridges and we were there in 10 minutes, despite having to pull our rolling luggage. From the hotel, it is also easy to access the water bus to get to St. Marks Square and Lido. It is also a pleasant walk to St. Margherita Square, which was a delightful array of restaurants and bars. The square was quite lively and entertaining, and quite a lot of younger tourists and patrons seemed to flock there. We had a great, though brief time, in Venice and at the Papadopoli. I look forward to returning! Diego, thanks again for everything. You were a pleasure and a great help.

Reviews.Title: “week end in venice”
Reviews.Author: frenchie71
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the airport VCE marco polo late at night, so we stayed to a hotel nearby, took a taxi but they are very expensive over there it costs us 50 euros for a 10mn trip. Next day we took the local bus to go venise itself only 3 euros for 3 people. very cheap. We got up to the terminus and the hotel is just on the other side of the bridge. Perfect when you have lots of luggage. Hotel sublime inside, marble everywhere. Left our luggage at reception and went for a tour of venise. Lots of little shops and bars and restaurants. But be ready to spend or leave your credit card at home. Very narrow streets and small bridges....very pretty. Lots of buildings with graffittis though shame for that. Had a tour in a gondola, he offered to take us for 100 euros for 2 km or 150 euros for 4 kms. When he saw my face he dropped it at 80 , told me business is quieter in the morning so i was lucky. The plaza st marco is very busy, queues are very long to get in so we gave up. You can see it is not cheap even for a coffee as most of the cafe terrasse are empty. My son had a great time playing the pidgeons. Behind the plazza you can find the street of the designers shops, like chanel, vuitton and others. Again you need a large credit limit c/c. The hotel was really nice, spacious bedroom,, we had one overlooking the canal, which was a plus, we had a bottle of champagne offered as it was our wedding anniversary, and the whole staff is very helpful. Breakfast was expensive 25 euros per person so if you' re not a big eater like me, you can have a croissant with coffee or juice in town for less..... Venise is a beautiful city, very busy in the centre, a bit less in the little streets. There are so many churches or plazza, that if you don't follow the signs for one to another you can easily loose yourself in this labirynth of "via"...the only thing i was disappointed about were the italians themselves. Especially in the shops or in the kiosques, they treat you as a potentiel thief...and when we tried to get help for direction, we were pretty much ignored..i felt .they were only nice with you when you buy something...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: AndrewReese
