Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The lobby and rooms are very nice and comfortable. It is close to the water bus which was very convenient. Our last two days of a 14 day honeymoon we took the water bus to Lido (the very last stop) which is a separate island and just laid on a daybed drinking beer on the beach all day. it was wonderful. The hotel has a breakfast in the mornings which was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in quiet part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: discusdoc
Reviews.Content: The Papadopoli in Venice is a very nice hotel that is close to the Piz. Roma but in a quiet section of town. They have several nice restaurants nearby and there is very little foot traffic compared to the more tourist-oriented sections of the city. The rooms were extremely clean and they had a good restaurant and bar in the hotel. This hotel is particularly convenient for people going on cruise ships (300 yards to the cruise shuttles and people mover) This is a good choice families, couples, and business people.

Reviews.Title: “Pop me anytime Papadopoli!”
Reviews.Author: Snow401
Reviews.Content: What stands out most in my mind as the number one indulgence of this hotel is the clean and ample feather pillows and comforter after a long day of walking walking. The breakfast was awesome, the staff wonderful and the locatio perfect. A few steps from the water bus that stops all over Venice. I would stay there again in a minute! The instant hot water for coffee and tea in the room were really instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a hotel that needs some T.L.C.”
Reviews.Author: andrew49673 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel will be great once Accor spends some real money towards renovation. The air conditioner leaked water through our ceiling although it didn't inconvience us. The restaurant is very pretty but overpriced. We went down for breakfast the first day and the room was full, we were shoved off into a spare room. That was not good. We ate out the rest of the stay. Our room overlooking the canal was comfortable but looked worn. The location is really great and convenient to all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if you are schlepping luggage & a good quality hotel,”
Reviews.Author: CocoaBeachtraveler Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Upscale bedding, towels and robes, in a quiet area of Venice near the train station and Piazzale Roma. Clean and comfortable. Probably priced well for Venice, but would prefer it to be a bit less costly. No need to take your luggage on the vaporetto all the way down to Piazza San Marco which is inconvenient and troublesome as you cross the bridges parrticularly. . We have stayed in the hotel the last 3-4 years we have visited Venice. While some of the rooms are really small, we stayed in a larger one - standard room - this time and could actually spread out with our suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Public Transport Friendly”
Reviews.Author: SLGE1982
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the bus terminal at the Piazzale Roma and is on one of the main walking routes into the city dont let this put you off. Its location is perfect to get "away from it all" at the end of a day of sightseeing and is in a convenient location to make full use of the waterbus at the Piazzale Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location! Close to train station.”
Reviews.Author: europetravel2011
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to train station. Locals know this hotel as the "former Sofitel" and they all know where it is. When you get lost they can direct you back to the hotel (which can't be said for all hotels in Venice). Clean rooms. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on Tolentino Canal”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only drawback to this lovely hotel is the access by land.... luggage had to lugged over a bridge from the bus station. Access by water via a water taxi is lovely. Service was excellent and room was clean, well fitted and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, best bed ever.......................”
Reviews.Author: Jill1056
Reviews.Content: Although not 'central' Venice i.e. not San Marco, rate as a great location as the walk to and from San Marco (numerous routes!!!) are wonderful. Also very close to railway station and Plaza Roma (bus station and waterbusses). The hotel itself was very comfortable with the best beds ever. Only complaint was slow service in dining room when we had diner there. The choice of english speaking channels on the TV was very limited. Not a problem if only staying in Venice a few nights but as were there for 7 nights we would have liked to have more choice. Reception staff very helpful and porter service first class. House keeping excellent with a great 'turn down' service each night. Probably won't get to Venice again however if we did we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “professional staff in a welcoming,clean,comfortable hotel in a perfect location for easy access to all areas.”
Reviews.Author: kaydbrown
Reviews.Content: When looking for the hotel, don't be fooled by the old name (Sofitel) which is still on the facade of the hotel. Easily reached from the bus/train station (5min walk). Choose restaurants carefully, can be very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Melly2207
Reviews.Content: This hotel spoilt us rotten!! As honeymooners we were greeted with welcome drink vouchers as well as a bottle of champagne and chips brought to our room within an hour of arriving. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Hotel was within 5 minutes of the train station-just note the hotel is still labelled as the sofitel (upon booking it does say formerly sofitel) the bed was very comfy and we had a beautiful maid who turned our bed down and left us night chocolates each night which was a lovely touch when we came back from dinner. Lovely romantic stay in a beautiful city. Thanks so much! Only hard part is getting luggage over the bridge but this is soon to be fixed when they finish building the facilities (this was advertised on the bridge) but in Venice you can't escape the bridges!! :-) part of the fun!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David186334
Reviews.Content: Just had a weekend at this Hotel (25th to 28th March 2011).Everything was first class the staff were efficient and helpful.The room was clean bed comfortable and fantastic pillows,which is not always the case even in quality Hotels.Excellent Buffet Breakfast.Hotel in an excellent position for journey to/from the Airport and city sightseeing.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend enough!”
Reviews.Author: Duet4123
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only spent two nights at this lovely hotel. On arrival the staff were really welcoming and helpful. Our room was wonderful, overlooking the canal so had a great view. Had a drink in the bar on the first evening, which was lovely. I would say the breakfast was over-priced so instead we used the little cafe opposite, which was really nice. We took the water-taxi provided by the hotel to Murano but beware - once there you need to make your own way back! Worth a trip through. Overall I would stay here again and would definintely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dung13
Reviews.Content: Very nice en quiet hotel, very good beds, lovely people, good breakfast. Only don't order american coffee, to fluffy.

Reviews.Title: “An outstandingly good experience”
Reviews.Author: Elek99
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in this hotel, during the Venice Carnival. Readers may be surprised to find that we have given the top rating under all six categories; they may think that this is the result of laziness or speed. Far from it - it is the result of carefully considerd judgement, made on comparison with five decades' experience of hotels in Europe (East and West), Africa, North America and Asia. The hotel, in the the Santa Croce distrrict, is excellently situated - a few minutes' walk from both the bus terminal the main railway station. There are vaporetto stops also within a few minutes' walk. So access to either the Veneto region, or to architectura,l artistic and historically significant sites in the city, was easy. Though the hotel is on a corner where a small canal joins the Grand Canal, it is quiet and peaceful. The hotel interior is comfortable, with good quality furniture and furnishings. The staff working in reception, the restaurant and in the bedrooms were exceptionslly friendly and efficient. We suspect that behind this was rhorough training. Our room was on a corner, with canal views in both directions. The room was spacious, well furnished, and immaculately clean. The bathroom had (unusually) natural light. It too was spotlessly clean, fitted with high quality, modern fittings and all the toiletries anyone could wish for. The towels were changed daily; the bedlinen on alternate days. The rooms had modern TV equipment; it was air-conditioned and the controls work,ed. Breakfast, largely self-service, but with constant arrention from waiters/waitresses when needed, was served in a splendid restaurant. There was a wide variety of hot and cold cold food, and drink, including some Venetian speciality pastries. In summary our experience here was entirely enjoyable and memorable. TAM & BHM

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ajf0677
Reviews.Content: This ex - Sofitel is in a very convenient location 2 minutes walk from Piazza Roma. Rooms are comfortable, and the beds are a dream to sleep in. Great attentive service. Very romantic boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: alison_j41
Reviews.Content: We went with friends and stayed for a 3 night break. Hotel was lovely. Stayed in room with balcony which was beautiful overlooking the canal. Quite a walk to the centre but not too bad. Loads and loads of lovely boutique shops on the way so very good. Hotel restaurants food is lovely just a shame nobody seemed to make use of it. Would recommend travelling over to Murano to see the glass being made although the staff do not leave you alone to have a look around and were a bit overpowering. All in all the hotel and the staff and very helpful and would definately visit here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is within easy walking distance of the Piazzale Roma bus terminal, especially good for not having to drag the suitcase too far over lots of bridges. We fly in to Marco Polo Airport, take the Airport-Venice Bus (3 euros) and approx. 20-25 minutes later we are in the hotel foyer. The hotel fronts a canal and it's easy to walk from the hotel to the main walking thoroughfares. Rooms well appointed, clean, staff friendly, breaky good. Will be back next time round.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneSky
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights from 15th to 19th of January, We arrived a bit early and our room was not ready -no problems- the very friendly gentelman at the reception took care of us, gave us a Venice map, and directions of what to do in the city! We left our bags at the reception and went for a walk, when we came back , as promised, our room was ready and to our surprise our bags were already taken to the room- Fantastic Service- Room was lovely! clean and elegant we had a beautiful balcony overlooking the canal. It was our honeymoon, and on the second night we were pleasantly surprised with a complementary bottle of proseco in our room, once again- Fantastic Service- I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: RioBix Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had our 3 year with us and chose a Superior King bed room overlooking the canal. It was all we expected and more - the front desk staff were excellent and helpful, the complimentary trip to Murano a real highlight, the in-room service staff did a great job every day as our room felt and looked refreshed and inviting, and our room really surprised us as it had a balcony we could stand on and see 2 key views of the canal. Whilst the location of the Hotel was very handy as we had a car and they organised a discounted rate for us, it was quite far (20-30 minute walk) form St Marco's Piazza.

Reviews.Title: “A charming traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: stefanopasini
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been customers for years of the most famous hotels in Venice and whilst we enjoyed them all, some of them have become monstrously expensive and IMHO some of them might not be worth that expense. This time we chose the Papadopoli hotel for a short stay because it's not as massified as other, more central hotels, and because its position very near to the Railway station was exceedingly handy for our trip. Arriving with a Frecciargento high-speed train we had to walk only 5 minutes to find the hotel, hidden around the corner from the Canal Grande, and leave the suitcase in the ample, traditionally-decorated room, From there it's 20 minutes of relaxed walk to Piazza San Marco. We found that the Papadopoli staff is eager to please, the bar is very charming with a classic look, whilst the look of the restaurant was quite...original. All in all a very charming hotel that will undoubtedly be our choice for the next visits to one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “parfect staying”
Reviews.Author: CHICCA58
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband decided to see Venice during the past Christmas Holidays to catch the different and magic atmosphere of Venice in December. We chose the fast train Bologna-Venice and so we selected The Papadopoli Hotel because of his strategic location, just a few step away from the railway station but in a very nice place; a sort of theatre " mise-en scene" that you can see in all the pictures. All I had to do to take pictures as beautiful as these was to look out from the window. The lobby is big and very elegant, with a wonderful bar where to taste spritz and other special drinks. But the rooms are so beautiful, in a romantic, classic style, perfect in every details, with a modern and very confortable bathroom, very well equipped. And if you open the curtains you have onother very good extra....the view. The breakfast room is very unusual, a huge window on the Giardini Papadopoli, a full immersion in the nature, and the gourmet buffet is very rich and can satisfy any customer. From the hotel you can easily walk to reach the Piazza San Marco, or stop in the nice rastaurant that you can find on the way, like the Osteria Ai Vini Da Gigio, near the Ca' D'oro, that we enjoyed so much. So a high quality hotel with a smart price for a perfect staying in Venice, one of the most beautiful city in the world! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at hotel papadopoli venice”
Reviews.Author: eboogie74 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at this hotel (while on my honeymoon) and I enjoyed my time at this property. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travelers on visits to Venice; especially if arriving into Venice by air/road/rail (this hotel is located about 5 min walk from Piazzale Roma - where all the buses arrive from the mainland including the airport express bus from Venice Marco Polo and Treviso airports). The main railway station is also nearby (short walking distance). Since I stayed at this hotel as part of my honeymoon travel, we were given a free upgrade to large, lovely room with a private balcony terrace that provided a view of the park and partial view of the canal (the view alone would've been worth paying a little extra). The bathroom was decent, but for a five-star hotel, it it could have used a few repairs/updates, but nothing major. The hotel staff was very helpful in recommending nice places to eat and providing directions to popular destinations across the city and transportation information for the railway station en route to our next Italian city destination. Only relatively minor issue during our stay was the elevators were not working during a portion of our visit which was not very convenient (our room was located on the top floor). Overall this was a great place and I will definitely stay at this property again on my next visit to Venezia. Can't wait to return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PatisserieDreams2012
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room with a private terrace and view of the park and canal, its worth paying that little extra. Although the bathroom could have done with a few repairs. The staff were very helpful in ordering water taxi's and recommending nice places to eat. Although i found it odd that the hotel did not offer a garment ironing service or irons in the rooms which most hotels have done previously. Also the elevators were broken during our visit which was not very convenient with our room being on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay once again”
Reviews.Author: kvillecouple
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Papadopoli (former Sofitel) three other times on business and was never disappointed. Decided to stay here again in November for 35th anniversary with spouse and we both have nothing but the highest praise for the entire staff and accommodations. The concierge staff were incredible, especially Francesco. Their reccomendations for places to visit, to eat and means of transportation were spot on. The breakfast at this hotel is inredible and was such a great way to start each of our seven days before we ventured out. The location of this hotel makes it very convenient to hop on a train or bus for day trips as we did and is still within a short walking distance of the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good sleep in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: Tinus564 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: + Practical, charming and good. Good and practical location near bus terminal and railway station. Quiet. Good restaurant with some traditional, local food on the menu. - As a business traveller, I would like a larger desk with goodlight, and another chair!

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: db1775
Reviews.Content: If you're schlepping your bags off the bus from the airport this is the dream hotel, within view from the station, right over a bridge. No crowded boat necessary. We had a cozy, comfortable room (Pricelined at $160) with a decent canal view and good people watching (Venetians going to work). The TV sucks but who cares. You don't want to be in your room anway. The area is a little creepy at night, maybe because the touristy part of town is elsewhere and the streets are three feet wide. My wife was attacked by mosquitoes the first night, so take precautions. The hotel will bring in some kind of machine upon request. Service was excellent...Stephano is a throwback and will be sorely missed if he retires next year as he said he would. Take the free boat ride he'll offer you, to Murano for the glassblowers. The return ticket you'll receive is good for the whole day, to go anywhere in the "lagoon." Seeing the more remote islands is totally worth it, even if the glass guy gets pissed at you for not buying anything. To see what Murano is supposed to be, head down the main drag and over a bridge where fewer tourists tread. Have a sandwich at the deli and hit a couple of glass stores where prices are better. Beware of the crappier places selling glass made in "Italy" but not Murano. It is cheaper but probably machine-made. Then double-back part way for the boat to Burano and Torcello. Both are lovely and wilder; the mosaic in Torcello's church is one of the best things we saw on the whole trip. So thanks Stephano.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome - Memories for a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Lois5107
Reviews.Content: We caught the bus from the airport and saw the name of the hotel as we arrived at the Bus station so we were able to walk straight to the hotel. The staff were fantastic and when we got to our room my daughter and I were literally LAUGHING OUT LOUD because it was so beautiful. The room looked out over the Canal and was a perfect location for going out and exploring. The hotel staff were so helpful and we felt 100% comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant location, gorgeous hotel and thoroughly enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: bel_a_26 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel far exceeded our expectations. The location was fantastic being within close walking distance of the train station and bus terminal as well as all the fantastic tourist sites of Venice. The benefit of this place is that it was away from the really touristy, over-priced areas of Venice. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and a delight to speak with. All staff were very polite and had a great sense of humour. The breakfasts at the restaurant were absolutely spectacular. We would spend a lot of time just working out what we would pick from the amazing array of breakfast foods. Without a doubt the best breakfast we had on our month long trip around Europe. Very memorable. The room was lovely and refreshed twice daily. Bed, pillows, and bedding all very comfortable. Overall we had an excellent stay at this hotel and would recommend to one and all. Not one to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel late and there was a little mix-up with the reservation but finally everything went ok. The room was nice and clean with a nice bathroom and good space. Breakfast was very nice and complete. Room service didn't have a very big menu but we asked for dinner and it was very good. Definetely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Very kind staff and fantastic location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Milvus_milvus10
Reviews.Content: For those who donâ€™t want to carry bags thru out Venice bridges and small streets, etc, and donâ€™t want to pay 100eurs for taxi, from/to airport, the location of this hotel is excellent. Just "one bridge" from Piazza Roma, where all land transport to Venice is. Then if want, is 20mnts walk to St. Marco square. Hotel personnel were very attendant and available for all request done, specially related with our tourist visit to Venice. I dislike the Hotel price. is high. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice classic hotel to be visited again”
Reviews.Author: DolphyGould
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we stayed there. The benefit of this hotel is calm ambience, surrounded by a beautiful public(quasi private) garden, the view of which we can enjoy from the breakfast/dinner restaurant. The serivice is well above the levelof the normal 5-star hotels, and the view of the canal from the top 5th floor is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, wish I was there now”
Reviews.Author: Forevermemories
Reviews.Content: My elderly (87-year-old) mother and I stayed for three glorious nights in a wonderful corner room with a balcony with a view of the canals. Our shuttered windows on the front side also opened out to the view of the canal and bridges. We were fortunate to be there when there was high water on our last morning so we could watch the locals heading off to work in their high water boots and business clothes. The water did not affect the hotel walkways but it made for wonderful photos and videos of real life in Venice. Our experience was superb in all ways. The staff at the reception on our arrival from SFO was welcoming and helpful to two bedraggled, jet-lagged women. Access to the hotel from the airport express bus is truly a 5 minute walk yet worlds away from the busy Piazzale Roma since the hotel is adjacent to a beautiful garden and separated from the incoming traffic. The water bus is also only a few steps away. All the major sites are easy walking distance from the hotel yet the hotel is very quiet for undisturbed sleeping. Staff in the stunning glass-roofed restaurant were also friendly and efficient. Breakfast was excellent with a good selection of pastries, yogurt, fruit, juices, hot eggs, sausage, bacon or ham plus cereals, breads and cheeses. My tiny mother ate to her hearts content, and she can eat more than most young hungry men! We hated to check out of this beautiful place but were kindly handled by the concierge who helped my mother into the water taxi for the cruise port to begin our Mediterranean voyage. This experience will remain in our memory forever as my mother's first and last trip to Venice. The Papadopoli was a great first stop on a long vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurocruise
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in this hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending it.Its location is terrific especially if arriving into Venice by air/road/rail as it is located 5 minutes walk from Piazzale Roma (where all the coaches arrive from the mainland including the airport express bus from Venice Marco Polo and Treviso airports). The main railway station is also nearby. The hotel is located on a canal with personalised service and venetian style rooms. Breakfast is buffet style with a good choice in a beautiful conservatory style setting. Being in Venice in August it was good to have a room with adequate air conditioning. The hotel is 15 minuteswalk to Rialto bridge and a further 10 minutes to St Marks Square. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “a woman”
Reviews.Author: incredible43367
Reviews.Content: I was in your hotel during last week-end of september for business. The hotel is really nice: on the entrance beautiful orchids, the room very confortable and well cleaned, breakfast in a perfect atmosphere, staff at the reception always smiling but one of them very bad infact an evening, coming back from my dinner, i went to the reception and i waited 10 minutes for him because he was inside the office speaking and laughting on his mobile phone with a friend, when he came outside he started to allure me like a man in a pub. I feel that your hotel is not safe for a woman alone and that degrade your property.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ernieking
Reviews.Content: We have visited this hotel four times in six years and are always amazed that the hotel staff are so very helpfull . stephano the concierge goes that extra mile to help.How he can always recognize us i will never know.There are many restraurants in the area all more expensive but not as good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, functional.”
Reviews.Author: Endor888 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wi-fi had to be purchased separately from Vodafone.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we stayed at on our trip...”
Reviews.Author: Beachtime01
Reviews.Content: The best hotel we stayed at on our trip! Service was great from reception through to the house keeping staff. Location is perfect, on the edge of the island which means you don't have to drag your luggage through the small streets of Venice. Room was a bit small, however bathroom was big.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: fireken57
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have been moved to write a review, but I feel this hotel is worth the effort. Specifically, the head concierge Stefano Vio. Without a doubt, this gentleman made our visit to Venice most memorable. It was my first visit to Venice and I was having trouble finding accommodations, but Mr. Vio came through in every aspect. The Papadopoli was full during the beginning of my stay and Mr. Vio made some inquires and arranged for a two night stay with a competitor. When I returned to the Papadopoli he greeted me with open arms, a pleasant smile, and impeccable service. The only negative (and I mean the ONLY negative) was that we were in a junior suite over the small bridge next to the hotel. This is very popular bridge and as I prefer open windows and fresh air (vs. air conditioning), the revelry on the bridge and streets could be heard most of the night. But I assume the responsibility for the open windows, so the hotel was wonderful. I would recommend the Hotel Papadopoli to any traveler that visits Venice. It may be a bit pricey for some, but well worth the cost. And the Head Concierge Stefano Vio made the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel--would return again.”
Reviews.Author: jbradleyum68 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great experience--did not know what to expect. Near the port-- very convenient for travelers leaving or returning from cruise ships. Hotel is well cared for. Rooms are clean and nice size. Staff is excellent. Gave us good advice on locations of sites, restaurants, and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: europair
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful three day stay here and enjoyed every minute from when we first walked through the entrance and said WOW! until we (sadly) checked out. We arrived early and were able to leave our luggage for a few hours until our room was ready. It is perfectly positioned close to the main bus station from Marco Polo airport yet peacefully situated in a park setting. The room was exquisite with luxury toiletries, fluffy towels and robes and a wonderful bathroom. The power shower was fantastic. The mini bar was actually a proper fridge so we were able to store our own drinking water there. The AC worked brilliantly. The breakfast was out of this world â€“ fresh fruits and yoghurts, breads, pastries, egg and bacon, cereals, fruit juices, meats etc. The service at breakfast was amazing as the waitresses quietly moved around the room replenishing every bowl and plate so that everything was always fresh. Our ONLY disappointment was the instant coffee. For twenty five euros a head for breakfast we would have expected fresh coffee. However, if you enjoy your coffee as we do, ask for a cappuccino or an espresso. This aside, we had a wonderful experience at the Papadopoli, even if it is experiencing an identity crisis and still thinks it is the Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “a really wonderful person”
Reviews.Author: breathmenow
Reviews.Content: we choose the hotel reading the reviews on trip advisor and in particular for the two concierges. When we arrived we was welcomed from Caterina the only one concierge staying on duty, we was really surprised and happy to know her because of her sensibility, professionality, sympathy and for all the historicasl and culturals information she gave us making our holiday really interesting and marvellous. Thank you Caterina

Reviews.Title: “Small but very, very nice”
Reviews.Author: Andy186284
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated literally a matter of minutes walk from the bus station which is next to the rail transport from the Tronchetta car park(s) and left luggage store. There were no Tea & coffee making facilities although there was a safe and a colour TV. There were no facilities for ironing the creases out of a shirt or trousers, which was explained as being against Italian law to permit guests to do this in their rooms, presumably a fire precaution. However housekeeping were more than happy to press these for me for something in region of 10 or 11 euros, which they promptly did, a small point but something I was not aware of. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English and although the rooms were particularly small they were very clean, comfortable and the hotel very well presented. Directly outside there was a beautiful footbridge over a small canal leading onto the grand canal next to which were water taxis and the streets nearby had various shops, cafes and restaurants. Breakfast was served in the small restaurant area surrounded by marble pillars and balustrades and although very nice, I felt it was in hindsight too expensive for what it was, next time we would have breakfast out. Leaving this small point aside, I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to friends, it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - for entering and exitiing Venice”
Reviews.Author: Core1602
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was OK considering my experience of hotels in Italy. The room AC did not work well but other than that the room was clean and comfortable. The service staff was very good, although the front desk people should take some lessons from the wait staff â€“ since the front desk people were short, terse and abrupt when asking them anything. The hotel is located very close to the main entrance into Venice and found it good for "being in Venice" without the inconvenience of being in Venice. I would likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris_C68
Reviews.Content: Papadopoli is in an ideal location. It is a gorgeous hotel with attententive staff who were always extremely kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with room for amount of money paid”
Reviews.Author: jh_turner
Reviews.Content: The downstairs area (reception & dining room) excellent : but in the bedroom the air conditioner was ineffective to reduce humidity & heat, the bathroom shower screen was leaking, wall paper peeling off, & the TV was an old CRT with a small screen & the internet was expensive. We had a small terrace outside the room which was ok, but mosquitoes were bad at night. We paid over Eur 480 for 3 nights- John T. PS I emailed my comments to customer relations; they replied that some of these concerns would be dealt with later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “La bella squadra”
Reviews.Author: prohatyn
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, but what makes it really special are the people, there. From the reception, to Stefano, the truest of Venetian concierges, to the bar and Andrea's perfect spritz, the breakfast crew always smiling, despite the horrible hours. Realy, a lovely hotel. The proof? My twentieth stay, give or take. Still have not met the manager, though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice due to Location”
Reviews.Author: Julie167
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night at the Papadopoli Venezia. The room was clean and comfortable EXCEPT the air conditioner did not work and this July, Venice was very, very hot!. The hotel is located in an ideal spot in that it is at the base of Tronchetto(where all of the cabs, buses, trains are located. It is on the Grand canal and also close to water taxis. The hotel advertises that it will provide one with a free shuttle to Murano but it did not accomodate us because we got there at 2pm and then asked. I do not know why they felt that they could shuttle us there and we had to take a water taxi at least an hour later to Murano/Burano. Also, do not expect to have a monetary exchange with this hotel. Get your Euros somewhere else before the exchange places close or use an ATM. I don't understand why a supposedly 5-star hotel such as Papadopoli does not have a money exchange process. It was very annoyoing at 9pm to find this out as we were leaving at 5AM the next morning! Otherwise, would stay there again and would recommend it to others (Oh, another puzzling thing is that you might miss the hotel altogether as at least on one side as the sign says Hotel Sofitel(which is what this hotel used to be called). The hotel restaurant food was good but too expensive and I would not recommend eathing in the restaurant(we were the only ones eating there on the evening of 7/24--stupid!!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with large rooms and good breakfasts.”
Reviews.Author: PatrizioYorkU
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from July 13 to 16, 2010. We booked a deluxe room very early, so got a good rate. The room was spacious and well appointed, andthe beds were fine (as opposed to other reviews). The only issue was the air conditioning. Could not get the room below 25 C. However, worked this out by closing the door to the washroom and the bedroom door to the vestibule, so AC was not being sucked out by bathroom exhaust system (as an HVAC person, I put a towel up to the exhaust portal and the towel stuck to the portal, which meant the AC was being sucked out of the suite faster than it could be put in throught the vent). When we first complained about the AC they were willing to move us to another room, and even have us sit in the room for a while to see if it was cool enough. In the end we stayed put. The concierge who was on duty on the evening of July 13 was truly very helpful on the AC issue, and on recommeding things to us and what to watch out for (even telling us not to take the free ride to Murano as you would have to make your own way back). The breakfast room was very nice and the food very good. The most important thing about this hotel, in my mind, was its location. Just across the canal from the train station and bus station, which made getting to it fairly easy. Also good to be able to connect with water buses (vaporators) and airport bus to Marco Polo. I would certainly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “EX Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: JonSeattle
Reviews.Content: Just come back from my two weeks vacation to Europe. The Papadopoli has the worst beds on this trip. I was woo-and-ahh's when I first went in to my room. Room is very, very nice, bed looks nice and lofty, and hotel also supplies wrapped bath robe and slippers. However, upon closer inspection, the springs in the mattress are so worn out that there is a permanent crater in the middle of the bed. The hotel staff refuses to switch the room when I requested. I had to sleep in a very, very uncomfortable bed for three days. Hotel maintenance is also lacking. One of the elevator was broken the entire time we were there. I have to drag my luggage down the stairs because the hotel staff are using the only working one. Now I understand why Sofitel gave up on the property. It would cost too much to maintain it. The breakfast was one of the nicest on this trip. The restaurant staff is very very friendly. Panna cota is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “It didn't live up to my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: bseo-pero
Reviews.Content: As a 4-star hotel, I expected something more luxurious than what we got. We were on our honeymoon, and this hotel came very highly recommended. So, I expected a nicer room than what I would find in the states. Instead, for 220 euro, we got an "ordinary" room. No frills--just the basics. Also, the elevator wasn't working properly, and while I don't mind going up 5 flights of stairs to my room, my husband didn't appreciate it. They offered a private taxi to Murano, but the taxi was one way. We had to find our own way back to city center, which I thought was odd. After a couple of nights, we decided to stay elsewhere, a 3-star hotel that had a working elevator and breakfast. The bright spot of the hotel is the concierge, Stefano. He was WONDERFUL!!!!! He guided us through the sights and sound of Venice, and he gave us advice and feedback about Lido and Murano. He saved our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in ideal position for seeing venice”
Reviews.Author: venicekent
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that we have stayed at the Papadopoli and every time we have been well satisified. It is a four star and comes up to the standard without being pretentious. The staff are excellent and helpful and will offer advice and guidence should you so wish. Rooms are clean and well supplied with the usual bits and pieces. It is in a quite area away from the noise of St Marks but easy to reach all the main sites. It is also so easy to get to from the airport as when you arrive at Pizzale Roma you can walk to the hotel. It is also close to the railway station if you want to travel to other towns and close to the water bus. I would really recommend this hotel. I really would.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations and friendly staff, overlooking the canal.”
Reviews.Author: gkcollector
Reviews.Content: The staff, from the folks at the restaurant to the head concierge (Stefano) were very friendly and helpful. They made sure that our stay in Venice was pleasant and enjoyable, offering helpful tips on everything from where to watch out for pickpockets to how much to expect to pay for gondola ride. The rooms were clean and comfortable, ours had a balcony overlooking the water that offered a great view morning or night. The location was convenien, close to shopping and restaurants, as well as just a few blocks from the main rail station.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming staff and lovely relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaDevon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Papadopoli for 2 nights after travelling on the ferry from Greece. I arrived just after 9 in the morning and although too early to book-in, the reception staff checked when the room would be ready and then stored my bags for an hour. All the staff had a ready smile and were so helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean. The hotel is in an ideal position for all transport facilities but it is lovely to walk/catch the vaporetto from here into the main tourist areas. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An inspired choice”
Reviews.Author: dispatch3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an inspired choice. We were hot and tired after travelling from Western Canada to Venice, with a connection in Frankfurt. A 5 minute (literally) walk from the Piazzale Roma to the front door of this elegant structure was exactly what we needed. The hotel is beautiful, with an elegant bar, lovely restaurant and Murano glass everywhere. The front desk staff are professional and helpful, especially the concierge, Stefano, Vio. Mr Vio has been with the hotel just shy of 40 years and is both knowledgeable and helpful. There was a bit of a mix up with a tour we had booked and he got it all sorted out for us in no time. There are beautiful little restaurants on the canal that runs between the hotel and the Piazzale Roma and we ate there frequently. Stefano arranged a water taxi for us 5 steps from the front door of the hotel to take us to the island of Murano, and the Grand Canal is only a 7 minute stroll. The free shuttle that took us to our cruise ship was right where the airport bus dropped off, a 5 minute walk. If we return to Venice we will definitely stay here again just for the sheer convenience of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: culturalwalker
Reviews.Content: My wife, two sons (ages 13 and 11) and I stayed twice at the Sofitel Papadopoli Venice around Memorial Day weekend. Weâ€™ve been to Venice previously, but never stayed here. One of our reasons for choosing it was the locationâ€”just across a bridge from Piazzale Roma. Knowing that weâ€™d have bags with us going into and out of the hotel, we wanted to make our arrival and departure easy. It was. Just a short (2-3 minute) walk from Piazzale Roma and maybe another minute or two from Veniceâ€™s Santa Lucia train station. But the hotel is much more than a great location alongside a quite canal. It has a fantastic staff that included all of the gentlemen at the front desk, Chiara in reservations and Stefano the concierge. We travel often (Morocco, Costa Rica, Croatia, Italy, Panama, Peru and Greece in just the last couple of years) and weâ€™ve occasionally found staff at other hotels to be disinterested or just pleasant enough to do their jobs. That is not the case at the Papadopoli. They are all pros AND very personable. In addition, the rooms were great. We occupied four rooms (two for each of the two stays), and all were very nice, extremely clean, well furnished, spacious, with very good lighting, views and amenities. The bedding and linens were also very comfortable. We recommend the hotel highly. And we canâ€™t wait to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - wonderful concierge”
Reviews.Author: mbf121160
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location. The Giardini Papadopoli is located near the bus and train stations. The water taxis stop nearby and make transportation throughout Venice very easy. The hotel is very clean and quiet. The concierge, Stefano Vio, has almost 40 years of experience in Venice and has recommendations for everything you may want to visit, ride or explore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Relaxing Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lin17
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice by train from Milan and found the bustle of the Grand Canal quite daunting - it was only a short walk to the hotel which provided an oasis of calm. The concierge (Stefano) was very helpful and recommended some good walks and tourist advice in general. We were offered a free drink on arrival which started the holiday off really well! Everywhere was walkable from the hotel but the vaporetto was also very convenient and we travelled to Murano and The Lido quite happily. The hotel is also conveniently situated for the main bus station from where we got our bus to the airport. Our room was small but pleasant and comfortable. Our 3-night package included breakfast which was plentiful and varied. Drinks at the bar were expensive but this was the case everywhere in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Friendly staff and a good location”
Reviews.Author: mickh749
Reviews.Content: The location is next to Piazza le Roma near to the train and bus stations. The hotel is friendly and quiet but only a 2 minute walk from the grand canal. It's quite expensive (quite normal for Venice!) but of high quality being a former Sofitel. We had a lovely room which I would describe as a mini-suite overlooking the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: TravellorsTravellors
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the bus terminal and the train station, the hotel still has Soffitel signage. We were given a lovely room with a large terrace. Concierge was very helpful and recommended a nice local restaurant. Hotel bar and restaurant provided excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: michaelcham1
Reviews.Content: Papadopoli (formerly The Sofitel) is in a great location (Piazzale Roma/Santa Lucia train station) only a few minutes walk from the Grand Canal and boats where you can buy unlimited travel for 66 Euros for 72 hours. It's about 15 minutes to the Rialto and 25 minutes by boat to St Mark's Square. You can also walk it ! Papadopoli rooms are comfortable and service good - only drawback is the restaurant which is badly in need of a makeover and modernisation. Bar is a bit intimidating too. However, price is reasonable - we paid (pre-payment package) 1,000 Euros for 5 nights in a room overlooking theTolentini Canal. You can get a train or bus from the airport or private limo at 70 Euros each way. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony845
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy to find (unlike most places in Venice) from Train Station. Dosoduro area is excellent (Lonely Planet review is baseless) - its real Venice! Lovely walk to St Marks via Academy Bridge away from chaos/noise of Venice Streets. Locals are helpful & charming too Stefano Vio, Head concierge is fantastic with a genuine passion for making sure you get exactly what you want from your stay in Venice. I will definitely stay here again. Beds so so so comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: pierotlunaire
Reviews.Content: Great location that is for shipping luggage from Piazzale Roma or Santa Lucia station to the hotel. Quiet backwater location, some way away from San Marco piazza but in reality only a short vaporetto ride down the Grand Canal. Some reviews talked about tired furnishings. Not that I could see however and the great Sofitel beds and bathrooms were there, and what more do you need in a hotel in Venice..... Food a little pricey but given the good weather I was inclined to eat out for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Trattorie and cafe bars scattered around nearby. Good bar and knowledgable bar tender. All in all absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MEUDIGIA
Reviews.Content: For about two years I have made many short stays at the Hotel Papadopoli when I was in Venice. I am a lifetime customer value. The staff is very kind and attentive to my every request. I often had dinner with my clients at the hotel restaurant Papadopoli and each time was a real success. The rooms are comfortable. The reception staff and pesonal of the bar are equipped with high professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “A "Veneziano" Spirit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jplg
Reviews.Content: Any year, during january period, we are hosts of "our" dear Papadopoli hotel. We found some interesting amenities like service room, typical restaurant or internet high speed but also and more important for us a particular "veneziano " spirit linking the professionality management of the service with the friendly and romantic atmosphere of a singular Papadopoli garden hotel. Mauricette HINTZY , Jean-Pierre LOZATO-GIOTART

Reviews.Title: “Lovely traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: LKW9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 10 year anniversary and had a wonderful time. We had a beautiful sunny room on the corner of the top floor. There was a stream of little additional gifts brought to us throughout, a really thoughtfully managed Sofitel. The decor is quite old fashioned but it gives the place a pleasant character.

Reviews.Title: “To forget”
Reviews.Author: Kong_935
Reviews.Content: I usually move me for reasons for job but this year with my wife I have decided to make her a gift and to bring her to Venice among the various options I have decided to go to the Sofitel or Papadopoli I don't have well still understands as it calls there is a little of confusion in web. It has been very easy to find we have arrived it from square Rome we have entered and the adventure is initiatedâ€¦ The personnel to the reception seemed robotic but polite any smile but kind they have immediately arranged us the room it perhaps had a strange odor for guilt of the carpet but we has not been so much to sometimes discuss, the elevators they jammed and we have used the staircases. During the first night it rained we have decided to remain in room to watch at night the television with problems of installation but he has been very available and he has repaired everything we have needed adapters and they have immediately arrived there. The morning we go down for the breakfast the price it is excessive but it didn't miss anything the personnel it seemed an a little confused the atmosphere it was not really so calm from a first breakfast but we have quickly done and in room is returned for then going out. Finally Venice a walk in the common places the charm of the city some souvenirs a turn in gondola my wife was enthusiastic there is no denying it Venice it never betrays a magic place for moments of serenity. This way we have reentered for an appetizer to the bar, there was no anybody but after a few minutes a person has arrived for the service that is very calm with a good music the normal service so many good things to eat and so many candles ended is returned in room.
