I have tried to make a conversation with the maitre but I have immediately abdicated him, he seemed discourteous and he had probably drunk more than me as that four or five person remind me that they have started dancing in the middle of the room so they has broken the compassionate silence the people wakes up of hit and them all they have goneâ€¦ The day later we have departed drowsy happy of Venice and away from the Sofitelâ€¦ (( Regards Kong_935

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in A Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: streakyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in December with our two daughters (20 &22). It was simply perfect. The Hotel Reception were warm, friendly and very helpful and the concierge was extremely knowledgeable regarding Venice, and EXTREMELY helpful with some inside knowledge regarding where to eat. If you are looking for some good Venetian food take my advice .. Don't just try to find your own way to a restaurant .. ASK the concierge .. the info is priceless .. AND FREE! We were given two rooms with an adjoining door which we left permanently open. The rooms were wonderful and our daughters were delighted with the little extra touches that this hotel offers from little welcoming biscuits and the array of toiletries in the bathroom. They also LOVE the luxurious bathrobes that were available to use during the stay. In fact my youngest daughter loved hers SO MUCH she bought one to bring home with her! The rooms had TV with some English Chanels and also Blockbuster Movies .. However WHO is going to watch TV when you are in Venice ??? Location is good .. It is far enough away from San Marco and the tourist centre to remain tranquil and calm but close enough to walk .. and walking in Venice is a true joy! The rooms are great and the ABSOLUTE best part are the beds which are by far the MOST comfortable beds you will ever sleep on! ... Downstairs there is a very nice bar which has a lovely atmosphere and we would always start off our evening with a little aperitif. Try the Spritz! .... Breakfast was great with a good selection of breads and meats and cereals all set out in a buffet style. The waitresses were very helpful and they even bought me a freshly squeezed orange juice when I asked ... There are also some hot scrambled eggs and sausages .. Alas NOT English sausages! .. But if that is the only thing I can fault with the Hotel then I cannot really complain can I? .... I would happily stay here again! ...

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here; rude staff, dated, old, dull and lifeless”
Reviews.Author: ilovethebeach86
Reviews.Content: This property is having a serious identity crisis; i booked it as a M label, however given everything from letter heads, to the sign above the door say Sofitel then I'm sorry but i expect sofitel service. This is the second time Accor has let me down and i have to say its just not good enough. Even if it was M Label it was bad. Location was good- but that's it. -The staff (except the polite cleaning lady) were actually terribly rude- useless and disinterested. -The room and hotel itself is extremely dated, mold in the bathroom, stuffy etc you get the point -The atmosphere was lacking- in fact i think a morgue has more life. Don't stay here- find somewhere with character, that reflects the real Venice. And Accor, Sofitel/M-label get your act together- its not hard!

Reviews.Title: “Italian adventure”
Reviews.Author: SUZYBermuda
Reviews.Content: During my research for hotels in Italy it was tripadvisor which provided me with the choice that I made of staying in the Sofitel Venice. Please do not misunderstand me the hotel was in an excellent location for walking to main train station. If you were like us travelling throughout Italy using the Eurostar Italia trains. As previously mentioned by another writer it's easier to use the water taxis to get to this hotel from the airport. Although if cash is short its a rather expensive way to get there, we paid roughly 80 Euro. Our rooms was a good size with a large bathroom, although as other writers have previously mentioned nothing fantastic for price of Euro 220.00 per night. Secondly the location is good for walking to all the restaurant options available nearby. For those of us from the other side of the pond, please note there is a small restaurant nearby which serves a good English breakfast for around 8 Euro. We found it on the second day of our stay after walking around looking for somewhere which did not serve strong coffee and rolls. I guess when in Italy you have to experience the culture therefore you cannot expect to receive pancakes, bacon, sausage or eggs. But considering the majority of the tourists I encountered were either American or from UK. Most of these restaurants could have had other options. Oh well this why you travel to experience other ways of life. Lastly we never used the hotel restaurant but my husband used the bar facilities and was not impressed at the cost of around 8 euro for a beer. Please note we are from Bermuda and we are used to hotels charging higher other establishments. But beer in a hotel in Bermuda does not cost $ 12.80. Another thing we noticed is that a lot of restaurants charge 2 euor for bread and 2 euro fee to eat in their restaurants, go figure. On the whole we did a lot of walking around Venice but one thing we noticed it's definitely not a wheelchair friendly place. The people are very friendly and helpful although we did not speak Italian. The staff in the hotel were also friendly and helpful when asking questions. But if you plan to visit Venice the Hotel Sofitel is a good location to stay. But it's very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: beau11
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Venice. We were delighted with the Papadopoli Venezia(but everything still says Hotel Sofitel). The staff was very engaging (particularly Stephano at the front desk). The location is close to the train station and water taxi (preferred way to get around Venice if not walking) so getting around requires walking, but Venice is a city that begs to be traveled thru on foot (and we are not hikers0. The hotel room we had was simply marvelous and clean with fluffy towels (my wife and I love those fluffy big towels). So bottomline is; if you want a great hotel and are willing to not be in the San Marco area, we highly recommend this gem.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: nikifitz
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights in march this year, and it was lovely, the rooms were nice, the staff were excellent, the location was fantastic, it isnt near the rialto bridge or anything really, but it was in a peaceful location with a few cafes and restaurants near by, i like to see the tourist things but i dont like to stay near them. we had a nice long through the back streets of venice and ended up finding a secluded place on the grand canal where an italian couple were having a picnic, it was so nice to be away from any tourists and to see the real side of venice. about a 10 -15 minute walk from the hotel is apparently the worlds first casino. Even if you dont like gambling, you have got to go. its the most amazing place i've been in Venice. It sits right on the edge of the grand canal, so you can get there by boat or walk through the back entrance, it takes a while to find but just keep asking the locals and you'll find it soon enough. its a huge mansion type looking building, and once you see it down the side street it looks fantastic, they have slot machines down stairs, and gambling tables up stairs, there are red carpets running through the hall ways and the decor is true italian style. for shopping,go to st marks square all the best shops are down there! an for anyone that doesnt know venice has a beach too!

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a "contemporary" room!”
Reviews.Author: RAGSBACON
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in a wonderful city. Lobby, staff, restaurant were all fine. But the OLD rooms are just that, beat up & battered. Demand! a redone one and away from the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Yblodyntatws
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel when it was owned by the Sofitel chain as I have really enjoyed staying in their hotels in the past. However, by the time we arrived it had changed hands and is now known as Hotel Papadopoli apparently - although even my bill at the end of the stay still said Hotel Sofitel. It therefore has something of an identity crisis. Clearly, this has been a very nice hotel in the past - but it is all rather faded I fear. Check-in: had to wait ages as only one person on duty who was having to deal with a very difficult/complicated group (however - he very pleasant when I eventually got to the desk) Lifts: if you suffer from claustrophobia - find the stairs! They are tiny, hot, and slow. Rooms: bed was brilliantly comfortable and I had a lovely balcony on the 5th floor which meant that I had lovely views across the rooftops. Air-conditioning was basic. Bathroom was a disappointment - cracked tiles and the grouting needed a good clean. The rooms were smaller than I had anticipated. Breakfast: OK - not brilliant. The coffee was truly disgusting and I'm sure they use UHT milk. Ugh! Felt as though I was eating in a jungle clearing. Bar: I gave up on trying to get any service one evening as it was deserted. On the other two evenings I felt as though we were inconveniencing the staff by wanting a drink! Having said all this - the fact that the hotel wasn't quite to standard didn't detract from our visit to Venice which we thoroughly enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “A classy, old-world hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbkmwj
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for ourselves and an adjoining one for the kids on the fourth floor. We had a small outdoor balcony, which overlooked a canal. The neighborhood was reasonable quiet. The location, near the train station and adjacent to the Papadopoli Garden, is outstanding. The hotel accommodated some special requests, allowing us to check in early in one room, so we could shower after arriving on a night train from Munich. (It probably helped that I'm an Accor Platinum loyalty card member.)

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Howlight
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, my wife and I were thrilled with the service at the Sofitel. The room was beautiful-my wife loved the balcony.The location is also excellent-we arrived by train from Florence- very easy walk from train station . Also easy exit to Airport as you'll appreciate after Venice grabs all your money on everything else. Howard 7/3/09

Reviews.Title: “Old World Style in a great location”
Reviews.Author: anthonybyrne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just come back having spent three nights at this hotel. We travelled to Treviso Airport from Dublin and got the ATVO (Ryanair) bus into Venice (Cost â‚¬10.00 each return- Great value). Tickets are available in the airport terminal, buy your ticket and validate in either the machine beside the ticket office or on the bus then you're away! Tell the driver that you want to go to Piazzale Roma then enjoy the journey to town We arrived on a Sunday morning and the journey took 30 minutes but the return in rush hour traffic took exactly 1 hour. When you arrive at Piazzale Roma you have practically arrived at the hotel, from the bus to the front door takes 2 minutes walk crossing one canal bridge then passing the small Papadopoli garden and entering the hotel from the canal side. We arrived early and our room was not available but the concierge took our bags leaving us free to wander and get our first tastes of Venice. The reception area is quite small but staff are helpfull. Also the hotel has a small bar and a separate restaurante. We didn't eat at the hotel but we tried a drink in the bar on one night and found a nice atmosphere though pretty quiet. There are two lifts at this hotel but they are very small, they work fine though. Our room was a twin room because there were no doubles left, we also upgraded to a canal view room which we enjoyed. The decor was stylishly old and the room contained what appeared to be antique furniture in the form of mirrors and tables. The twin beds were comfortableand there were extra pillows and blankets in the wardrobe. The bathroom was well stocked and a mini bar in the room. There was a safe and air conditioning also but we chose to leave the window open to take in the gentle canal noise coming from below as well as listening to the general evening and night chatter and the bird song. At the front of the hotel there is a jetty and the reception staff are happy to phone for a water taxi who will pick you up from here, pretty cool I must say! The Santa Croce area where this hotel is located suited us perfectly because it's a nice quiet area and a pleasent place to return to after visting the bustling San Marco Square, Rialto Bridge areas. the Grand Canal is less than three minutes walk from the hotel and about five minutes walk from the closest water bus stop. The water busses are busy and quite full but is a fantastic way to see the city and the surrounding islands. My favoiurite bus line is the number 2 bus which gives a good broad view of all the main attractions of this magnificent city as well as sharing with the locals one of the nicest ways to commute anywhere. We were plesantly surprised with the prices in Venice haveing been scared out of our wits with stories our excessively expensive shopping. We come from Dublin so with this in mind we are used to relatively high prices but I'm sure that because of the strength of the Euro that people from the UK and the USA could feel a little sting, but I would still recommend this city and Sofitel Venice hotel. Just something to look out for though, restaurant menu prices don't bear any resemblence to the bill at end, so be on your guard.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: racb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of the location and wanted to be away from san marco. I have to say i really enjoyed the location and found the staff very helpful. the room was on the smaller side but was comfortable. but changes are afoot...hotel will leave sofitel chain at end of June.

Reviews.Title: “I had a better room when I used to stay at youth hostels.”
Reviews.Author: queenkathleen
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Sofitel Venice as we speak, having booked a 3 night package through RCCL prior tp a cruise. I have stayed at many wonderful Sofitels before so selected this one even though it was the most expensive of the choices. Now the hotel itself is beautiful but the room I am in (I am one person)is literally the size of a broom closet and I had to move he bed to get my suitcase in the door. Wallpaper is peeling off the wall and I iterally burned my hand on the lamp above my bed trying to adjust it - metal shade. The one twin bed is like an army cot. The manager/front desk have been no help. They are simply sold out because of a big art conference in town...but I had had this reservation for months,,,why do I have to suffer. I know they have nicer rooms because I have seen them. I a being charged almost $600 per night for a room that is pure junk - I eally have stayed at better when I used Arthur Frommer budget hotels. I know rooms can be smaller in europe and I am not a complainer, having traveled for years, but this is by far the biggest rip-off I have experienced ever. I intend to compain to Sofitel derectly as well as RCCL. This room should be made into a storage closet. They should be ashamed to put someone in here to stayed and more ashamed to charge what theycharge..

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hdnlaw
Reviews.Content: Great location, room service lagging a lot

Reviews.Title: “Like a fairy tale!”
Reviews.Author: curtisam
Reviews.Content: This was the most outstanding hotel that we have ever stayed in! We had gone to Italy for my brother's wedding and spent the last four days of our trip in Venice. We checked into the Sofitel and were given a very nice double room that had a window facing a canal. We were tired from traveling all over Italy and decided to stay in Venice for the remainder of our trip. (We had originally planned on going to Verona for a couple of days.) Anyways, we asked the front desk if we could get an upgrade and we moved to a fairy tale room on the top floor for no extra charge! The room had a terrace where we could eat breakfast and watch the sun rise over the city while boats started their daily trips up and down the canals. The service was spectacular! Room service knocked on the door at exactly the time breakfast had been requested. The matradee, Marco, was very friendly and added to the pleasantness of our stay. The waiter in the bar was almost as equally nice. Every evening there would be a knock at the door from housekeeping to see if we needed anything. We thought that staying at this particular hotel was an excellent way to end a wonderful vacation. If you can get a room on the top floor, with a terrace, I would recommend it. I noticed another review mentioned that the hotel food was great. You can not go wrong eating there. On a scale of 1-10 the food was a 10! There was a young man at the front desk that always had a smile on his face and very pleasant to deal with. I would agree with another review that some of the other front desk staff was robotic like, but they still weren't bad enough to ruin our stay at this incredible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Faded and not upto Sofitel standard”
Reviews.Author: snmbe3
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several Sofitel hotels previously we booked this one, despite some unfavourable reviews, because of our previous good experience. We were very disappointed that the standard of this hotel by no way matches the typical standard you expect in Sofitel hotels - this hotel is clearly low down on managements priority list. In fairness the hotel was clean and everything worked though the front desk is clearly understaffed as the receptionist took 6 telephone calls whilst we were checking in and this appeared to be a not untypical situation. As soon as you emerge from the small fairly tatty lifts into the hotel corridor and see the threadbare hall carpet you know you have not made one of the best accomodation choices. Also we found the hotel a bit far out and if we would return to Venice would definitely stay closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeNSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We spend two nights here as part of our Costco package. An excellent hotel. Clean well furnished rooms. We had a balcony and great view. The staff was as nice as could be. Our adapters did not work and they took care of us and brought us one right away. Breakfast was very good and had a great selection. Bar was cozy and very friendly. Location is near the train station but on a quiet canal. Easy to walk to San Marco and other sights. Don't miss Scuola Grand Rocco. But take the water shuttles which are located very near by. Couldn't ask for anything nicer. Will stay there next time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “If you can You MUST stay here”
Reviews.Author: SooperTrooper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Absolutely wonderful Hotel. From the moment we walked in we were made to feel very very welcome (Complimentary Gifts). Got to our rooms (More complimentary gifts including Teddy Bears on the kids beds) and were greeted with a beautiful view of a quiet canal. Hotel is positioned really well in relation to main car parks in Venice and very easy walk to the Grand canal and all thats around there. Would have been nice if they could have accomodated us all in one room (2 Adults 2 Children) but they couldn't. Recommend Highly if you want to splurge a little.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet haven”
Reviews.Author: bettygillian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Venezia Sofitel hotel as part of a small group, for a long weekend. We were very impressed both by the charming hotel and the kindness of the staff. One of our party was unwell and the front desk staff were very helpful finding the help that she needed. The hotel is very conveniently placed on the North Corner of Venice, with easy access to the main vaporetto (water bus) terminal and a ten minute walk through pristine, beautiful streets to the Piazza San Marco or a 15 minute boat ride. Our room was fairly small with a balcony and an amazing view of the terra cotta rooftops of Venice. The room and hallway were furnished with antiques but the bathroom was very modern! The Sofitel restaurant food is marvellous by the way. We were very pleased with the charm and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: David_Susie
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Sofitel Venezia. Not cheap but you pay through the nose for anything decent in Venice. Contrary to some other reviews my wife and I had a very comfortable stay. The reception staff spoke excellent English and were welcoming. The catering staff were exceptionally friendly but the waiter did tend to go wandering and was somewhat hard to find when you were desperate for that afternoon drink after 8 hours of walking over bridges and getting lost in Venetian alleys. Our room was fairly small but had a nice outlook, was quiet, well furnished and very clean. One of the two lifts was out of action during our stay which was a little inconvenient at times but the fact that the hotel is conveniently located and was a comfortable, quiet haven from the hustle and bustle of Venice made our stay very pleasant. While many Italians are abrupt this can be mistaken for being rude. They aren't rude....they are just Italian...I heard remarked. (I also heard that "Italians don't queue"...too true.) Take it in good humour and you'll have a ball. I do think all Italians appreciate it if you make an attempt to speak some Italian. Even if it is from a travel guide.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: FranklinsFresno
Reviews.Content: WOW-This hotel really layed it out for my 50th birthday. They upgraded our room to a room with a view and a balcony towards the front of the hotel. We took the water taxi there from the airport just to see how it was. I can't explain how much fun it was just have a boat pull up to your hotel. Excellent service in everyway. The concerige, namley Stephani was just absolutely wonderful and always greeted us going or coming. It was located in a great location. I will upload photos of the room soon. I will never hesitate to stay there again. It was very romantic there just as Italy is. That country feels great and it helps when your comfortable at night. We walked that city more than any other. They have 100's of shops, just one after another. we are going back as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venetian Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Vandygirl
Reviews.Content: Sofitel was close to the train station making for an easy commute to and from. Although it was a good distance from St Marks Square and the Rialto, the quiet off beaten nature was one of the best parts. Tons of little shops nearby that werent overpriced like near the square. The room was lovely and the views were great. The staff was very polite and helpful and had no problem with our late check out. Would stay at again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: nippychic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel the 1st week of May this year for our honeymoon. I had stayed at the Warsaw Sofitel before and had been very impressed with it so that is why we chose the Sofitel Venezia, although we were quite worried about the quality of the hotel after reading so many awful reviews but we were very pleased with everything the hotel had to offer. We had a deluxe double room at the front of the hotel overlooking the canal. We were very pleased about the location of the hotel as it is on a very quiet,small canal off the grand canal and away from the noise and tourists. From the moment we entered the hotel we were greeted by very friendly reception staff who welcomed us, gave us maps and a lovely book of Venice. Our room had a flower arrangement along with a present and a typical venician mask which we thought was a lovely touch. The room was not huge but very adequate with a balcony overlooking the canal. The room and bathroom were spotless with bath robes, slippers and very nice toiletries. Breakfasts in the hotel are buffet style with plenty to chose from including 3 hot trays of eggs and bacon etc. The setting of the restaurant is beautiful with chandeliers and a real feel of being in an outdoor conservatory with greenery and bark as the wall decor- its very attractive. The restaurant although very pricey was lovely with a harpist playing as you eat. We shared a huge whole grilled fresh fish brought to the table and served to us- it was beautiful. We found the bar very handy for late night drinks and snacks- lovely salads.The staff always said good morning and afternoon to us each time we entered the lift, or were leaving or entering the hotel- something that I felt was very welcoming. All in all we were very happy with our choice and would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “think twice about staying here”
Reviews.Author: lolabarney
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for two nights in April, 2007. On the positive side: it is very close to the train station (about a ten minute walk), thus avoiding pulling your luggage over the bridges and taking the water bus. But far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the station that you still feel you are in Venice. The Rialto bridge (shopping area) is about a 15 minute walk - very convenient and several nice restaurants in the immediate area. Very nice buffet breakfast, well presented and prepared with a wide variety of choices, as you would expect from this chain of this level. Restaurant staff were pleasant and friendly and handled the large crowd with ease. The hotel was quite busy, but everyone was seated and served efficiently. Rooms were a good size (we stayed in two), one having a nice little balcony, Bathrooms were also spacious with a nice soaker tub. Clean and fluffy towels in the bathroom with an extensive selection of bathroom amenities. The bedsheets appear to be new and of high quality. On the negative side: unfortunately, this property is not up to the standards set by other Sofitels (and I have stayed at many). It has remained unchanged since my first stay in 1998 (and again in 2005). Frankly, the entire hotel needs a complete renovation. The lobby is dark and dated. Rooms are very, very tired, the carpet being so dirty and threadbare the pattern has been worn away. There was gum on our carpet which had turned black. The bedspreads were so worn you could see the white lining coming through. Furniture is chipped. Our bathroom was in better shape (surprisingly so), but there was still some mould and cracked tiles. On our first night, we were at the back of the hotel which faces a park. This sounds great, except it is also the passageway to the bus terminal. Never has a park been so noisy. They moved us to another room which was better. If you stay here, insist on a room at the front of the hotel facing the canal. In closing, I would only stay here again if they did a complete renovation, as the location is excellent, but I think for the money you are paying, one could do better elsewhere (for now).

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Butz
Reviews.Content: I am rather hesitant to use drastic language, but the Sofitel Venice, unfortunately, deserves it! I like Sofitels, in general, and know some of them very well. This seems indeed, as another critic put it, to have been "forgotten in in the Sofitel portfolio". When in Venice you think romantic places, good food, nice people, cozy hotels. Might all be the case, but not at the Sofitel: 1. Unfriendly, borderline rude recptionists (even in light of Italian standards), wearing shabby and dirty clothes. 2. Mould in the bathroom. 3. Had to wait in line in the lobby with a dozen people before being seated at breakfast, on a Sunday 4. barkeeper even managed to mess up making a simple hot chocolate, not to mention other drinks he plainly ruined 5. there is a difference between rooms with antiques and some patina and, as we had to witness, dust and filth! Now, all this for several hundred Euro? My wife and I felt much better upon leaving this place, even though we, as well, originally dreamt of romantic places, nice people....

Reviews.Title: “Very good alternative when in Venice”
Reviews.Author: dividendo
Reviews.Content: Very good stay. Note this is one of few hotels (and think the only one with 4 stars) that you can access by land - thus saving more than 100 euro in water taxis from/to airport. We got upgraded to a suite so my pov is not accurate for all of the rooms: This one was wide, excellent view and air conditioning worked perfectly. Walking to St Mark will take you 20 mins: As others have said, Venice is the perfect city to get lost, so... In Murano island window shop around before buying. You can get beautiful stuff at excellent value. Restaurant right across the bridge from Sofitel very good choice for a night when you need some rest and don't want to walk. Very good breakfast included in room price. Ample assortment.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: gloria8888
Reviews.Content: This hotel must have been forgotten in Sofitel's portfolio. Having stayed at Sofitels before, I wanted a safe choice for Venice, supposedly the highlight of our trip. Unfortunately, $400/night gets you extremely dated carpets (we thought they had installed them before I was born in 1974), a stained toilet seat, and a cracked and moldey bathtub. Service was rude and unhelpful. This was the second worst hotel I had stayed in my month vacation in Italy; however, the worst one was a barely 2 star in Milan for a fourth of the price. Ignore the 4 stars; this is a 2 1/2 star hotel in my book, and at those prices, I'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectection!”
Reviews.Author: 34Italy
Reviews.Content: Best place we stayed in all of Italy! Large, VERY clean room. Delicious breakfast, with much better selections that previous hotels we stayed in! Extremely easy to get to either driving in & returning car rental as we did or from train station...both are across canal & walk right to hotel with luggage. Friendly, helpful staff/conceirge/bartender (who gave us a great wine selection to take up to the room at a very reasonable price)! Room was VERY nice & quiet. Leaving was easy too as taxi to airport just across canal. The only place I will stay next time in venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location away from the hordes”
Reviews.Author: SoCalifornian
Reviews.Content: We flew overnight from Los Angeles to Venice and found this to be an ideal first stop. Walked off the plane, grabbed our luggage, hopped on the city bus right outside the terminal (1 euro!), and were whisked to within a minute's walk of the Sofitel. The hotel is quiet and short walk from what seemed to be real Venetian street life (lots of bars, gelaterias, restuarants). Venice is of course beautiful, and even moreso if you aren't trapped with the hordes around St Mark's (which is splended, but of course overrun by tourists like you and me). The walk through the city to St Mark's took us 20-40 minutes (depending on which meandering route we took), and Venice is of course a spectacular city in which to walk. The waterbus and train station are also close by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Venice, enjoyable stay, great location.”
Reviews.Author: tagor
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a family vacation, which included a two night stay in July 2006 at the Sofitel Venice. Overall our stay at the hotel was a positive one, and I would recommend it to others, however there were a few things could use improvement, and I will try and be as objective as possible. We chose the Sofitel for two reasons, one the location, and two because we wanted an upscale "modern" hotel with comfortable beds and air-conditioning. We had an early flight (6am) when leaving Venice, and wanted easy access to Piazalle Roma so that we could take a land taxi to the Airport. We were VERY happy with this decision, not only for our early morning departure, but for our arrival as well. It is situated on a lovely smaller canal, a short walk (less than 5 min) away from the main foot bridge that connects Venice to the mainland at Piazalle Roma. The airport can be accessed by land taxi from here for a reasonable fare of aprox 35 euros, as opposed to over 100 euro each way for a water taxi. If arriving by train or car, you will arrive at Piazalle Roma as this is "the end of the road" so to speak. I can not stress enough how convenient this is. In my opinion the location is IDEAL. When arriving in Venice with luggage, you really only have two options, walk, or take a water taxi/vaporetto to your hotel. It is VERY difficult to carry luggage in Venice. You constantly have to lug it up and down stairs to cross bridges over canals. The streets are narrow and crowded, and it is very HOT in the summer months. During our stay we constantly encountered tourists who were lost (as getting around Venice can be a bit confusing), wandering through the streets with their bags, seemingly on the verge of collapse. This would always make us thankful for our choice of hotel location. We found that staying away from the craziness of St Marks Square very nice. It was about a 20-25 min walk, or you could catch the vaporetto. Venice is a tourist city, it is safe and enjoyable to walk even at night. There are many shops and restaurants along the way. We were told, if you get lost, don't worry you are on an island! Just follow the signs to Piazalle Roma, or St Marks Square and you will be fine. We chose the Sofitel because we had read horror stories about hotels in Venice. They are all small, some dirty and run down, many with no air conditioning. Our thinking was that we could trust the well known French hotel chain. I made our reservations on the Accor Hotels web site, but actually e-mailed the hotel directly a few times with questions, and my e-mail was always promptly and friendly replied to. Since it was our 10th wedding anniversary, and we were travelling with our 9 year old son, we decided to reserve a Junior Suite. I also decided to reserve the "dream maker package" because it included tickets to the Peggy Guggenheim museum , a bottle of Champagne on arrival, one dinner for 2 people, a welcome drink at CafÃ© Bar and a 1 hour trip by private boat. (We were particularly looking forward to the 1 hr boat ride) The package added aprox 200 euro to the price of the room (for the two night stay), but we thought that considering the price of a nice dinner for two in Venice, and the cost of a private boat ride, along with the other perks, it would be worth it. (We were wrong) Check in was a pleasant experience. The lobby is small but elegant. A live harpist plays music in the evenings, which we found a very nice touch. The front desk staff was friendly, and we were shown to our room which was ready when we arrived. The junior suite was on one of the top floors, overlooking the front of the hotel, right on the canal. The view was beautiful. It was our first time in Venice and being able to look out and see the gondolas was very romantic. The room was small for North American Standards. The Junior suite was only slightly larger than a "normal" hotel room in Canada, however it was spacious enough for the three of us and very nicely furnished. There was a king bed, with very comfortable mattress and bedding, and a cot was set up for our son. The room also had a sitting area with sofa, chairs, an antique wooden writing desk and furniture. The bathroom was modern and nice, the shower drain was a little slow, but this did not really cause any problem, and the door latch was hanging loose with a missing screw, but the room for the most part was in excellent condition. We did have to leave the air-conditioner on high the whole time, and the temperature never got cold, however it did cool the room to a reasonable level where we felt comfortable, considering it was VERY hot outside. Other guests have commented on an odd smell in the hotel. There did seem to be a smell in the hall, that we could not identify, however we could not smell anything in the room. One other thing to note was the incredibly small elevators. It was actually comical, and never really caused any problems, but getting more than four adults on at one time would be difficult without a shoe horn! Breakfast was included and served in the beautiful Winter Garden restaurant. It was quite average, not really noteworthy in any fashion, certainly not the best buffet we experienced on our European vacation, but not the worst either. Our dinner (included in the rate) was very nice as well, however we were the only guests in the restaurant. It was amusing to watch the male wait staff flirting with the attractive female harpist for most of our meal, as they really had nothing else to keep them busy. The meal was good, but we probably would have dined elsewhere had it not been pre-paid. The real disappointment was with the boat ride. We had seen the beautiful boat the hotel owns and were looking forward to going for a ride in it. As a matter of fact we had decided not to take a gondola ride because of this. When I went to the concierge to arrange the boat ride, I was told that it was not included in my rate. I told him that it was included, and he then agreed to give us a free "taxi" ride to St Marks Square. I think that he still not believe me, and was offering this as a "favour". I declined and instead returned to my room to get the print out of the confirmation stating we were entitled to a one hour private boat tour. Upon returning, he took a photocopy, and somewhat reluctantly booked our boat trip for the following morning. He was also at the same time constantly trying to talk us into taking a "free" boat trip to Murano, which we continually declined after reading about how high pressure these free trips could become. We met in the lobby the following morning, and he escorted us to the boat. He said a few words to the driver, who we don't think spoke any English, and then turned to us and said "your driver will drive you around for 1 hr and drop you off at the hotel or St Marks Square, but we don't have a licence to drive in the Grand Canal, so we will have to go around". We were then driven out into the industrial basin, past condemned buildings, sewage, and piles of scrap steel. We were taken out into the ocean, through the port, and eventually dropped off at St Marks Square. The driver did not speak a single word the entire hour we were afloat. We had expected at the very least a nice romantic, scenic tour through Venice on it's canals. Had even hoped for some sort of a guided tour, with points of interest being shown along the way. We are not sure if this was revenge for insisting on getting our trip, or if they really couldn't drive in the city (plenty of other boats certainly do), either way this was not at all what we had expected and were VERY disappointed. The other minor problem was on check out when our included dinner was charged to the bill. This was removed when pointed out. This seemed to be a recurring theme throughout Italy. The Italians love to smile and charge you for things you shouldn't have to pay for...LOL. All in all, we loved Venice, and were pleased with our choice of hotel. The junior suite was very nice and the view was great. I would recommend booking a junior suite, however do not book the dream maker package as the perks are clearly not worth the extra. The staff didn't really out perform, however they were friendly and efficient. Possibly not the Flagship of the Sofitel chain, but a very comfortable modern hotel, and especially in Venice this can be hard to find. I would recommend the Sofitel for anyone looking for an upscale hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Aude
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for our stay at the Sofitel Venezia because we generally love this chain. Unfortunately, we were quite disappointed. The room's air conditioner worked very poorly -- it blew out warm air, and during this very hot time in Venice our room was way too warm to sleep comfortably. Adding to the yuck factor was the condition of our small balcony: Its floor held a couple of inches of dirty water. The size of the room itself was decent, and the bathroom was nice. The public areas were lovely. However, for the price we paid we expected much nicer accommodations. I would not even consider staying there again. And I'm not very picky! A note to those of you who plan to book this hotel: The Sofitel is accessible by land, as it is right next to the Piazalle Roma. If you're arriving from the airport, don't waste your money on a water taxi. You can get there very cheaply by land taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a true Sofitel masterpiece ”
Reviews.Author: la_travel_agent
Reviews.Content: This is another truly great Sofitel property The hotel was beautiful, the staff was great. The restaurant was awesome, the breakfast staff magnificent. It is about a 20 minute water taxi ride away from St Marks Square. If you want piece and quiet, stay here. If you want to be in the chaos of St Marks Square, look for another property.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: limelight_orange
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru accorhotels and got a really good deal for 175 Euro per night (double) including breakfast! But for the triple, the price was around 225 Euro (incl. breakfast too). Getting to this hotel is easy, from the St. Lucia station, just cross the bridge on the left (yes it's heavy with luggages) then turn right and go all the way until you cross the bridge. After that you'll meet a bridge again, but don't cross this time. Just take left and go for a few walks until you see a garden with gates and a huge Sofitel Venezia sign. If you don't like walking you can take the water taxi and stop at the Piazzale Roma. From there it's really easy to locate the hotel. The receptionist was quite friendly. We were given rooms on the first floor (lifts are SO SMALL only fits 5 people w/o luggages). The rooms are really antique and beautifully decorated. We had 2 rooms, one triple and one double. The triple one had no view at all. You open the window and get to see the glass roof of the Papadopoli restaurant, so if you wake up in the morning and open the window you can actually see people eating down there. But the double's view was really great! It face this little street with a lot of passers by. The beds are really great. The triple room had 3 beds, one of them is a set-up bed but have the same comfort as the other two. Everything was so beautiful in the rooms (Decorated in 18th century Venetian). The triple was larger than the double. The bathrooms are really nice, and they provide you with towels, bathrobes, etc. Breakfast was really good in the 'Winter Garden', a really beautiful place. Try to wake up earlier if the hotel's quite full since the place wasn't too big. The breakfast service was absolutely great and they would serve you anything with smiles! And if you're confused on where to go and stuff, the Concierge was really helpful and they seem to know everything about Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something near the station as we were arriving quite late. We saw that the Sofitel had very positive reviews on Tripadvisor so we booked it. It certainly merits the ratings it has received. We stayed for two nights and were extremely happy with it. Our double room, which was very clean with a lovely canal view, turned out to be more like a suite - separate bed and seating areas with a tv in each. The bathroom was also quite spacious and well equipped. The only meal we had at the hotel was breakfast but, again, everything was fine. The buffet provides enough choice to ensure there is something to suit everyone. All the staff we met were very friendly and helpful and last, but definitely not least, the location is a real gem. It's only a few minutes walk to the train station, the stop for the bus to the airport and the stops for a number of waterbus services. That said, it is 40 minute waterbus trip away from St Mark's square. However, the Sofitel more than matches many of the more expensive hotels nearer St Mark's plus the no 1 waterbus route, which is two minutes walk from the Sofitel, takes you to St Mark's via many of the main sights along the Grand Canal so we didn't see the journey as a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite usual Sofitel Standards”
Reviews.Author: dogsareforlife
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Sofitel Venice. We booked a deluxe room (via the Sofitel website) at EU287 per night. We chose the hotel based on its location and the fact that I like Sofitel hotels - theyâ€™re generally a very good standard (New York and Washington being exceptional) and I also belong to the Sofitel loyalty scheme which tends to influence my decisions on where to stay. The hotel is easy to find being just yards from the Piazzale Roma - fairly easy to manage even with suitcases. It sits near the Campo Tolentini, facing a small canal. Although the walkway past the hotel bridge is busy, the hotel was very quiet. The reception area is very grand with an enormous Venetian glass chandelier in the middle of the main area. To the left of the entrance is a lovely bar/library area for people watching, directly in front is the â€œWinter Gardenâ€� where breakfast is served and to the right, a small reception/concierge area. Check in was just OK. Not very welcoming and not much eye contact made. We tried our (little) Italian but were answered in English. Finding a room seemed to take some time but eventually we were given room 525 which was on the top floor. The concierge insisted on taking us to our room to show us the features. The elevators in this hotel (2 of them) are TINY - just about enough room for 3 people and two medium suitcases! But only just. The room was small but had access to a balcony which surrounded it and gave stunning views of the church opposite and the roof tops of Venice. There were several windows in the room and the breeze from being high up was welcoming. Bed was great - the usual Sofitel bedding which is extremely comfortable. There wasnâ€™t much room to walk around but there was a built in wardrobe, dressing table and several other tables and a chair. The TV was on top of the well stocked but pricy mini-bar. Internet access was available in room if required but I cannot remember the tariff. No in-room coffee or tea making facilities (or Ice for that matter) was a disappointment. The bathroom as a big disappointment! Again, small but very scruffy with mouldy grout and cracked tiles which had been badly patched up. It was cleaned well each day and the towels replenished but I expected much more from a Sofitel. The water pressure was inconsistent as was the heat of the water. The bedroom too was scruffy with cracked plastic skirting boards and a carpet that really needed replacing. The colour theme was dated (soft greens and peaches) - very â€œ80sâ€�. Good job we didnâ€™t spend much time in it as it would have begun to feel claustrophobic very quickly. Breakfast each morning was a large continental buffet selection with very pleasant waiters and waitresses bringing coffee and tea. You could also request eggs, omelettes and other items in addition to the buffet. Breakfast in your room could be served but this wasnâ€™t included in the room rate and they charged EU6 for each item over and above a very basic menu. The setting for the breakfast was lovely - the so-called â€œwinter gardenâ€� which overlooks the reception and canal. It is a glass room covered with vines which gives the impression of dining al fresco! It was a great way to start each day and had a very relaxed atmosphere. We didnâ€™t use the concierge as we tend to be independent travellers. Neither did we dine at the hotel in the evening, preferring to try several restaurants closer to St Markâ€™s square - mostly for the atmosphere in the evenings - its fun to people watch as you eat. The Venice 72hr Blue Card was excellent value at EU68 for two (about Â£48 or $60). This pass gave us unlimited use of the Vaporettos including trips to islands (it includes the Lido too but we didnâ€™t get there). It also allowed you to use the public washrooms for free. It was extremely convenient to have the pass instead of getting a new ticket for each trip but the card is very flimsy and easily damaged. It comes with a great map in a plastic wallet. Get your pass at the airport (just turn left at arrivals and pass the long queues for the bus tickets) the booth is on the right. It doesnâ€™t take long to walk to the Rialto and then on to San Marco. There are several routes you could take and we tried them all. The Vaporetto stops at Piazza Roma and the Train Station (Ferrovia) are a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. If you like to explore on foot, this hotel is an excellent location. If you donâ€™t like too much waking youâ€™ll need to stay closer to San Marco. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™d choose this hotel again until itâ€™s had a re-fit. The public areas are lovely but the room was tired and needed money spending on it. At about Â£550 for 3 nights B&B in Venice it wasnâ€™t bad value - but neither was it brilliant value. It just missed the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, odd smell”
Reviews.Author: TankT
Reviews.Content: Always hard when only one thing is wrong with a hotel, as we have stayed at the Sofitel twice. But this time, our room was permeated with a very odd smell, not "canal", not easily recognized. WHen we said something, they moved us immediately to one floor lower, which still had a faint trace of that smell. The "left side" (left off the elevator) seemed to be the problem side, as our friends on the right side had no trace of this. But everything else was great! Great breakfast, nice staff and location is perfect for transport back and forth to the airport. Just a thought, if this problem hasn't been fixed. If the room smells a little odd right at the beginning, move to the other side of the hotel.
